Jacqueline es una mujer casada de 23 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales cursan el nivel inicial, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y abarrotes,  eligio este tipo de negocio ya que su Padre lo inicio, y porque le parece que es un negocio rentable y porque puede estar mas tiempo con su familia.
Jacqueline es una mujer trabajadora, honesta con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a  su familia, empezó en el negocio hace 1 año, gana un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles semanales.  Con el crédito que Kiva le otorgará de S/. 1500.00 soles será invertido para la compra de abarrotes (azúcar, leche, fideos, etc) y ropa de temporada ( pantalones, polos, camisas, etc), uno de sus sueños es que tenga su propia casa y que pueda ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio para que le puede generar mas ingresos y puedan llevar una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree que es una buena cliente y que si cumplirá en sus cuotas.

Jacqueline vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 23, is married and has two young children in elementary school. She sells clothing and groceries, and chose this type of business because her father started it, because it is a profitable business, and because it allows her to spend more time with her family.
Jacqueline is a hard-working, honest woman with a great desire to get her family ahead. She started her business one year ago and makes an average of 200 soles per week. With this Kiva loan of 1500 soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries (sugar, milk, pasta, etc) and seasonal clothing (pants, polo shirts, shirts, etc). One of her dreams is to have her own home, and for her business to keep growing bit by bit so that she can have a greater income and a better quality of life. The loan officer who assessed her thinks that she is a good client and that she will honour her quotas.
Jacqueline lives and works in the famous city of Nazca, or Nasca, Peru. The city is known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: to buy groceries (sugar, milk, rice).

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Uno Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, cerdos, gallinas, inició este trabajo con un pequeño capital, y lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de gallina ponedoras y de engorde, ya que espera mejorar su producción de animales. Las demás integrantes del grupo de dedican a la agricultura, a la agropecuaria y al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Ana, age 47, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has six children, one of whom is in school. She raises small animals: hogs and chickens. She started this business with a small capital, and has eight years' experience. Her husband, who works in agriculture, supports her.
Ana organized a group to request a loan which she will use to buy laying hens and hens for fattening. She hopes to improve her animal business. The other group members work in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Lucio Juan

texts.es: El señor Lucio es un cliente antiguo, que demostró buen comportamiento de pago de sus anteriores créditos, vive en la zona de Brasil, al norte de la ciudad de el alto,  el señor Lucio se dedica a la venta de cocoa (chocolate en polvo),  en las distintas ciudades de Bolivia como Sucre, Potosí y Cochabamba entre otros, este tipo de actividad es de forma ambulante y de venta por libra, la cocoa proviene de los yungas (lugar cálido de Bolivia y conocido por la producción de fruta, coca, cacao y otros). El mayor sueño del señor Lucio es el llegar a tener una fabrica de chocolates y exportarlo a otros países del mundo, pero sabe que esto solo lo podrá logran con esfuerzo y el financiamiento de terceros, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el pago de la ultima cuota de su vivienda, el sr. lucio se siente agradecido y feliz por la oportunidad que se le brindaron.
texts.en: Señor Lucio is an old client who has a very good history of payment in his previous loans. He lives in the Brasil zone in the north of the El Alto city. He sells cocoa (powdered chocolate) in various Bolivian cities such as Sucre, Potosí, and Cochabamba. He sells on the street, by the pound. His cocoa comes from Los Yungas (a hot region of Bolivia known for the production of products such as fruit, coca and cocoa). Lucio's greatest dream is to have a chocolate factory and to export to other countries, but he knows that he can only achieve this through hard work and financing. He will use the money from this loan to make the final payment on his home. Lucio is grateful and happy for this opportunity.

loans.use: to make the final payment on his home.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is taking out another Kiva loan of 50000 KES to boost her food stall business. With the loan, she wants to purchase food stock and utensils for use at the business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business and meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase food stock and utensils for use at the business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, Sara has operated a business selling tea leaves to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs, and her dream is to establish a retail shop to sell her products in the future. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, Sara wants to purchase more packets of tea leaves to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a café, frequented by her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major business challenge of high transportation costs. Rose dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  de 40 años de edad casada, trabaja como estilista en su propio salon de belleza desde hace más de 20 años.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de comprar productos para su negocio (tintes, pinturas, otros), pues se acerca la epoca de promociones y navidad y sus clientas demandan mas atencion y trabajos y asi puede ofertar a sus clientes diferentes cosas para que sus clientas esten satisfechas con el trabajo que ella hace en su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old, married, and has worked as a stylist in her own beauty salon for more than 20 years. She is asking for her 3rd loan with the intention of buying products for her business (tints, dyes, etc.) since she's approaching sale season and Christmas. Her clients are asking for more care and services. Also she can offer her clients different things so that they may be satisfied with the work she does in her business.

loans.use: to buy business supplies (tints, dyes, etc.)

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Nimasac Group

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian en el nivel primario, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos de diferentes diseños, inició con un pequeño capital y los prestos nada mas y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para tricotado y tejidos de cortes típicos, espera ene el futuro contar con un negocio grande y con operarios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al tejido de cortes típicos, elaboración de candelas y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Andrea, age 28, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has three children, two of whom are in elementary school. Andrea weaves traditional clothing. She started off with only a small amount of capital and some loans, and she now has eight years' experience.
She has organized a group to request a loan which she will use for the purchase of threads for knitting and weaving traditional clothing. She hopes to have a big business with employees in the future. Some other group members also weave traditional clothing; others make candles or raise small animals.

loans.use: to buy threads for weaving traditional clothing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Joyce has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Joyce rents a shop where she works from , by means of retail. 

Joyce has requested  for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids for the festive season.  Joyce's main business challenges include include thieves, defaulters, and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked salon, also to educate her children up to university.  Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married to a man. She and her husband have four children between 6 to 20 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past three years, Rose has been selling dishes. She has more customers and is earning more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes for her business. In the future, she plans to send her children to school until they finish college and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes for her business.

loans.name: Deylin Del Socorro

texts.es: Deylin de 30 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos estan pequeños en edad preescolar, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida que asume los gastos del hogar. Deylin labora el MINED Santo Tomas desde hace 10 años como directora en una comarca de este muncipio, donde supervisa a los maestros de esta zona o bien les apoya a brindar clases cuando alguno se enferma. Esta solicitando  su 5to credito con el objetivo de terminar de mejorar su casita, pues con los creditos ha logrado instalar el agua y  levantar con piedras la mitad de su casa y desea terminarla para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Deylin is 30 years old and single. Her children are small and preschool age. Also she has the help of her life partner who takes on the household costs. Deylin has worked with MINED Santo Tomas for the than 10 years as the director in a region of this municipality where she supervises the local teachers or helps them provide classes when someone is sick. She is asking for her 5th loan with the objective of finishing improvements to her small house. With the loans she's been able to install plumbing and to raise the middle of her home with stones. She would like to finish the house in order to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish home construction.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is a single mother of 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father. 

Sarah has a business selling smoked fish. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah retails her products at the market. 

Sarah has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of smoked fish. Her main business challenges include thieves and transporting baskets of fish from Gaba Landing on Lake Victoria to her stall . Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, to start selling wholesale only, and to educate her children up to university. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena  de 59 años de edad es soltera, ha trabajado como docente durante 20 años, pero actualmente se jubilo y recibe mensualmente pension como maestra jubilada, ademas recibe el apoyo economico de sus hijos que trabajan pero que habitan con ella. Esta solicitando su 12vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo una tapia que le permita dar mayor seguridad a su casa, ya tiene hecho los arranques y parte del material.  Cabe mencionar que Maria ha logrado mejorar su casa poco a poco con los creditos otorgados por AFODENIC pues con el credito anterior logro construir su cocina y hacer el pantry, la cual le quedo muy bonita y comoda.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena is 59 years old and single. She worked as a docent for 20 years, but now she's retired and receives a monthly pension as a retired teacher. She also receives financial assistance from her children who work but who live with her. She is asking for her 12th loan with the objective of improving her home. She is building a wall which will permit her to have more security in her home. She's already made the base and part of the material. It is worth mentioning that Maria has been able to improve her home little by little with loan awarded from AFODENIC. With the previous loan she was able to build her kitchen and make the pantry, which is very attractive and comfortable.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father.   

Mary has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products retail at the market.  She has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas   

Mary's main business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and transportation of bunches of bananas from the villages to her stall . Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale and to educate her children up to university. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Marbelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Marbelly es casada, trabaja como coordinadora Administrativa en el Centro Social SOS desde hace 8 años . Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa, la cual es muy pequeña y como esta esperando su 2do hijo desea esperarlo con mejor comodidad.  Cabe señalar que ha utilizado sus creditos para mejorar su vivienda, pues ha ido acondicionandola poco a poco para comodidad de su familia.
texts.en: Marbelly is married and has been working for eight years as an administrative coordinator at an SOS social center.  She is requesting her fourth loan with the goal of building a room in her house, which is very small.  Since she is expecting her second child, she hopes to wait for it in greater comfort.  It is worth pointing out that she has used her loans to improve her home, since she has been equipping it little by little for the comfort of her family.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father and mother). 

Esther has a business of making sponges.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 6 days a week. Esther sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Esther has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more raw materials, like fish nets, to make sponges.  Esther also generates additional income through selling piped water.  The main business challenges for Esther include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to employ two boys to assist in making sponges.

Esther lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making sponges

loans.name: Eric Aaron

texts.es: Eric de 22 años de edad es soltero, trabaja como tecnico en Hardnica desde hace 4 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de estudiar un postgrado en gramatica inglesa, lo que le permitira trabajar mejor en su carrera como ingeniero informatico, pues anteriormente solicito un credito que le permitio obtener su titulo de Ingeniero Informatico, y como esta carrera pide que sepa de ingles quiere aprovechar para fortalecer mas sus conocimientos la oportunidad de estudiar aqui este curso que le abrira mas puertas a nivel profesional.
texts.en: Eric, 22, is single and has been working as a technician at Hardnica for four years.  He’s asking for his fourth loan to study a post-graduate course in English grammar that will make it possible for him to work better at his job as a Systems Engineer.  He requested a previous loan that allowed him to get his degree in Systems Engineering and because this career requires him to know English he wants to avail himself of the opportunity to strengthen his knowledge taking this course here which will open more doors for him at a professional level.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course in English grammar.

loans.name: Daniel Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel, se dedica al servicio de fotocopias,  vive en casa familiar, de los papás del Sr. Daniel, no tienen hijos, y tienen su fotocopiadora cerca de una universidad, comparten ambientes con el centro de estudiantes de Sociología.  El crédito es para la compra de una  fotocopiadora ya que habiendo gran demanda de estudiantes que necesitan realizar fotocopias y ampliaciones, esta fotocopiadora le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el Sr. Daniel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia, es emprendedor desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniel has a photocopying business.  He lives in a house belonging to family members (his parents' house).  Daniel does not have any children.  He has his photocopying business in a location near a university.  He has his business in a location shared with students of sociology.  Daniel will use his loan to buy a photocopier as he has a great demand from students who need to make photocopies and enlargements.  This photocopier will allow him to provide his customers with a better service.  Daniel is a very hard-working person and feels happy with the support he is being given.  This is his only source of income for supporting his family.  He is an entrepreneur and would like to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer and spare parts for his photocopier

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father and mother).   

Prossy has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days a week. Prossy sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Prossy has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  She also generates additional income through dry cleaning. The main business challenges for Prossy include thieves and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to start going to the villages of Masaka for bananas.  Prossy lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Nicaja Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica ala confección de prendas, inició este negocio confeccionando pantalones y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de maquinas in industriales, y mejorar su producción de pantalones. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Lesbia is married. She is 27 years old. She had no opportunity to study. She has three children, one of which is studying.

She works making clothing. She began this business making pants and she has had six years experience up to now, with the help of her husband who works in the same trade. 

Organizing a group to ask for loans this member is asking for a loan to use to buy industrial machines in order to improve the production of pants and the other members of the group work in agriculture and the breeding of animals.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers  for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales, cerdos y pollo de engorde, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y tiene 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de de pollos de engorde y la alimentación de estos, espera en el futuro contar con un capital mucho mas amplio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is married.  She is 47 years old and completed 6 years of her primary education.  She has 9 children, 4 of whom are in school.  Her business is raising animals (pigs and chickens).  She started this business with a little capital and has 7 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a farmer.

Eusebia got together a group to request a loan for buying chickens to fatten and feed for these animals.  She hopes, in the future, to have more capital.  The other members of her group farm and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, and chicken feed

loans.name: Estrellita Azul Group

texts.es:
El comité Estrellita Azul nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Vicenta, tesorera del grupo está casada, tiene 2 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación; asi como también ser una líder ejemplar para las demás integrantes de su comité. Ella nos comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días trabaja duramente y la cual es el sustento de su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Estrellita Azul communal bank was created through the management and support that it received from another communal bank that was working in that place. 

This communal bank is in San Lorenzo city. The members of the communal bank set as their main goal the personal development of each one of them. Within the institution, they are known as hard working women.

Vicenta, the group's treasurer, is married and has 2 children. She is an enterprising, innovative woman who has shown an eagerness for self-improvement throughout all these loan cycles. She has also demonstrated that she is a great leader for the other members of the communal bank.

She says she owns a little grocery store where she works hard every day and which helps her to support her family.

She seeks help from Fundación Paraguaya to buy groceries, beverages, dairy products and other goods for her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages, dairy products and other goods.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres al Poder  nace mediante la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,, quienes  tiene como objetivo principal ayudara a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La Sra. Adolfina, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, y nos cuenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo ha logrado ir creciendo, ya que desde siempre ha trabajado. Ella desea que por medio de su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, pues se acerca la época de fiestas y quiere estar preparada para la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres al Poder' community bank was created by a group of neighbors and friends from the town of San Lorenzo.  Their main goal was to help their families through their joint work.

Adolfina is one of the members of this group.  Her business is selling drinks.  She tells us that, thanks to her efforts and work, she has managed to grow her business.  She would like, through her business, to continue growing in her business and helping her family.

Adolfina is requesting this loan to buy drinks.  The holiday period is approaching and she would like to be prepared to meet her customers' demands.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
Originario de Granada, de 35 años de edad, es David, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos al por mayor tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, tiene 6 hijos todos menores de edad pero estudiando para un futuro mejor.
Cuando inicio fue con la venta de productos perecederos vendía al detalle luego empezó a trabajar poco a poco a vender al por mayor lo que le permitió hacer prosperar mejor su negocio aunque ha sido un proceso lento pero seguro  ya que son productos de consumo diario en la población además para vender granos básicos al por mayor se necesita de mucho capital pero es un negocio que genera buenos ingresos por eso el trabajo a diario en esta actividad el vende en un local ubicado en el mercado de Granada y su esposa lo ayuda a atender a los clientes mientras sus hijos los mayores van a la escuela y lo ayudan durante el fin de semana. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar frijoles al por mayor. Pues es un grano que forma parte de la dieta alimenticia de la población se consume diario y genera buenas ganancias. Entre sus metas esta lograr ser auto sostenible, hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
From Granada, David, 35, is a merchant.  He sells basic grains like beans, rice and sugar at wholesale.  He has six children who are all minors attending school for a better future.

When he started out it was selling perishables at retail but then he started to gradually sell at wholesale which led to his business prospering better although it’s been a slow but steady process since his products are consumed daily by the population.  To sell at wholesale one needs much capital but it’s a business that generates good income and this is why he works at this job daily.  He sells in a locale located in a market in Granada and his wife helps him take care of customers while his older children attend school; they also help him on weekends.

He took out the loan to buy beans at wholesale because it’s a grain that forms part of the population’s daily nutritional diet and is consumed daily thus generating good profits.  Among his goals is becoming self-sufficient and to make his business grow and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Suhey Del Socorro

texts.es:
Suhey, de 33 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, ella es comerciante, vender ropa y zapato lleva tres años con este negocio. Inicio con esta actividad con apoyo de su madre quien la apoyo a ella al quedar embarazada necesita tener un negocio que le permitiera generar ingresos para criar a su pequeño hijo. Fue entonces que se fue a vender con su madre al mercado ropa y zapatos es así como se gana al alimento diario para ella y su familia.   
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos para vender durante la época navideña donde la afluencia de clientes es muy constante durante esta época del año y ella no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender.  Pues una de sus metas es lograr comprar una casa para que su hijo tenga un techo digno en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Suhey, 33, lives in the city of Granada.  She’s a single mother of a three-year-old son.  She’s a merchant.  She sells clothes and shoes and has been in business three years.  She started out with this activity with help from her mother who supported her when she became pregnant and needed to have a business that would make it possible for her to earn income to raise her small son.  It was then that she went to sell clothes and shoes in the market with her mother and this is how she earns her and her family’s daily food.

She requests the loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell during the Christmas season when customer abundance is very constant during this time of the year and she does not want to waste this opportunity to sell because one of her goals is to manage to buy a house so that her son will have a proper roof over his head.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Jeronimo Fidel

texts.es:
Don Jerónimo de 44 años de edad, es originario de Granada , tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, el es comerciante se dedica ala venta de leña desde hace 30 años. Este negocio lo trae por herencia familiar  pues la familia de su padre vendía leña pero al quedar su padre incapacitado para seguir trabajando el se tuvo que hacer cargo y de este forma ayudar con los gastos del hogar  desde entonces este ha sido su primer negocio. 
El realizo el crédito para compra de leña de origen renovable pues en su comunidad trabajan con madera renovable como medida de protección al medio ambiente. Su principal meta es que su hijo no le falte nada asista al colegio para que se supere y lograr darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jerónimo, 44, is from Granada.  He has a 10-year-old son.  He’s been a merchant selling firewood for the last 30 years.  He has this business as a family inheritance since his father’s family also sold firewood but when his father became unable to continue working he had to take over and help with household expenses; since then this has been his first business.

He took out the loan to buy firewood from renewable sources because in his community they work with renewable wood as a way of protecting the environment.  His main goal is that his son not lack for anything, that he attends school so that he can improve himself and to attain a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy firewood from renewable sources.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité esta compuesto por 15  integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnacion, son clientes a partir del mes de noviembre, se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia., pues desean darles un futuro mejor.
Una de las integrantes es Ramona, quien trabaja todos los días y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, en lo cual no le va mal, ya que siempre tiene buena venta, desea poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para abastecerse y de ea forma tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella al igual que sus amigas del grupo están agradecidas por la ayuda que la fundación y Kiva les brinda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up 14 members from the city of Encarnacion. They are customers from the month of November, and are in the first cycle of the program of the foundation’s women entrepreneurs. They are hardworking and enterprising women fighting to keep their families prosperous because they want to give them a better future.

One of the members is Ramona who works every day and has made many sacrifices to push forward and help her family. She tells us that she works selling all types of clothing, and she is not doing badly, she always makes sales, and she wants to be able to continue growing her business, and this is why she is asking for a loan to buy all types of clothing in order to stock up and in this way to have more variety to offer her clients.

She is just like her friends in the group; all of them are grateful for the help that the foundation and Kiva gives them.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell later

loans.name: La Cumbre De Pasajoc Group

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda es casada, tiene 36 de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales específicamente la crianza de pollos de engorde, inició criando pollos, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo para solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas pollos de engorde y mejorar su producción, espera en el futuro tener una granja. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, bordado de blusas,  y a la confección de delantales.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is married, and she is 36 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children; two of them go to school.

She raises animals.  Specifically, she raises chickens to fatten.  She started raising chickens, and she now has ten years of experience.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and she has his support.

She organized a group in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy more chickens to fatten and improve her production.

In the future she wishes to have a farm.

The other members of the group raise pigs, embroider blouses, and make aprons.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Adriana, de 53 años de edad, es comerciante vende comida y frescos en Granada de donde es originaria, tiene 3 hijos de 20,18 y 13 años de edad respectivamente todos ellos están estudiando. Ella inicio con este negocio al dejar de trabajar como domestica  viendo que la situación estaba difícil para continuar buscando trabajo emprendió con su negocio de venta de comida con refrescos fue difícil al principio pero lo que la hace diferentes es que el sabor de su comida es casera y no comercial esto le ha permitido ganar clientela, salir adelante con su familia en donde su hija mayor le ayuda en sus ratos libres después de la escuela. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de materia prima tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, repollo, tomate pues son parte de los ingredientes que utiliza para realizar sus platillos y refrescos. Uno de sus planes futuros es poner un kiosko donde pueda vender fijo ya que ella vende en su casa de habitación y sale a repartir su comida pero le gustaría expandirse un poco mas por medio del kiosko.
texts.en:
Adriana, 53, is a merchant selling food and refreshments in Granada which is where she’s from.  She has three children who are 20, 18 and 13 years old respectively and all are studying.

She started her business when she stopped working as a domestic employee and seeing that the situation was difficult regarding finding another job she started her business selling food and refreshments.  It was difficult at first but what differentiates her is that her food tastes home-made and not commercially produced and this has created a large clientele for her and has allowed her to get ahead with her family; her oldest daughter helps her in her free time from school.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, milk, cabbage and tomatoes because they are part of the ingredients she uses for her dishes and her refreshments. 

One of her plans for the future is to set up a kiosk where she can sell in a fixed place since she currently sells form home and goes out to sell her food but she’d like to expand a little bit more with a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca, de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad respectivamente, ella es originaria de las Isletas localizada en Granada. Empezó con la necesidad de percibir ingresos pues lo que generaba su esposo no era suficiente para la manutención de su hogar. Tomo la decisión de irse a vender con su madre granos básicos pues ella se dedica a esta  actividad hace varios años en el mercado de Granada y es así como se gana la vida y el sustento para su familia.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar y purina que es un producto nuevo que quiere vender pues con esta inversión quiere surtir su inventario de productos de mucho consumo y necesidad en su vecindario e ir agregando nuevos. Por lo pronto le gustaría reparar parte del tramo donde almacena su mercadería para hacerlo mas seguro.
texts.en:
Blanca, 34, sells basic grains.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 5 years of age respectively.  She is from Las Isletas located in Granada.  

She started out because of the need to earn income because what her husband earned was insufficient to support her household.  She made the decision to go out with her mother selling basic grains because that’s what she had been doing for many years in the market in Granada and this is how she too now earns her livelihood and supports her family.

She needs the loan to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar and Purina which is a new product she wants to start selling.  With this investment she wants to stock her inventory with products of much need and consumption in her neighborhood and to gradually add others too.  For now, she’d like to repair the area where she stores her merchandise to make it more secure.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar and Purina which is the new product she wants to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria es una cliente antigua de la fundacion Paraguaya, con 6 operaciones canceladas en forma excelente. Ella es de la ciudad de Encarnación, esta casada, y tiene 1 hijo, quien la inspira a salir adelante y luchar por sus objetivos.
Comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida y que gracias a su negocio y a su arduo trabajo ha logrado ayudar a su familia y salir adelante. Es una persona muy trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora, quien manifiesta que no se cansa de trabajar para darle lo mejor a su familia, pues no quiere que pasen por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con carnes, bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo que podrá seguir ofreciendo mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a long-standing client of the Fundación Paraguaya.  She has had six loans that she repaid in excellent form.  She is from the city of Encarnación.  She is married and has one child.  Her child inspires her to get ahead and to strive to meet her objectives.

She says that she has a well-stocked grocery store.  Thanks to her business and her arduous work she has managed to help her family get ahead.  She is a very hard-working, enterprising, and tenacious person.  She states that she does not tire of working in order to give the best to her family.  She does not want them to encounter the hardships that she had to experience.

She is requesting the loan to stock her business with meat, drinks, groceries, dairy products, and other staples.  Then she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, groceries, dairy products, and other staples.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Anibal tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Luque. Comenta que hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la venta de agua mineral, anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, fue así que fue conociendo a muchas personas.
En un momento dado decidio independizarse, fue asì que hace aproximadamente 3 años recurrio a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya para obtener un crédito y de esa forma poder comprar bidones para el agua que vende. En la actualidad ya posee su propio vehículo y piensa seguir ampliando su clientela.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de más bidones para utilizar en su negocio, pues es un elemento muy importante para el. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad de crecimiento que esta le da.
texts.en: Mr. Anibal, 34, is single and lives in the city of Luque. He has worked selling purified water for eight years; he previously worked for a different company, and through his job he met many people. About three years ago he decided to strike out on his own and start his own business. He went to the Paraguay Foundation to obtain a loan, and he began buying the water jugs to use for his business. He is thankful for the opportunity to grow his business that this loan will give him.

loans.use: purchase water jugs for his company

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina lives in the coastal town of Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. 

Lina owns a clothing shop which has been in operation for thirteen years. She employs three other staff in her businesses. Besides this enterprise, Lina also runs a vegetable kiosk.
 
She was invited to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit. She is applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase new clothes. She plans to open other clothing shops in the future.

The extra income from this business will enable her to educate her children and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Digna Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Digna es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por el cantón Paute (Cuenca) lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras, cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

Doña Digna tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido un hijo quien es mayor de edad y vive independiente. Su esposo se dedica al comercio de ropa, la casa en la que habita es arrendada.

La Señora Digna se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos, cerdos y ganado, los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración de sancocho y fritada (platos típicos) actividad la que realiza hace 12 años.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos. 

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Digna is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank. 

She lives in the Paute canton (Cuenca), an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.

Digna is 46, married, and has one grown and independent child. Her husband sells clothing. They live in a rented home.

Digna does the housework; raises chickens, hogs and livestock; and also makes sancocho and fritada (traditional dishes) on the weekends. She has been doing this for twelve years.

This is her second loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of chickens and hogs.

Her goal is to finish her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and hogs.

loans.name: Martha Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por el cantón Paute (Cuenca) lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras Cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

La Señora Martha tiene 25 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 4 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Martha se dedica a cuidar de sus hijos, en sus tiempos libres vende productos naturales de Herbalife, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo, también entrega frutas en los mercados gracias a que su esposo trae en el camión.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales de Herbalife.

Su meta es subir un puesto más alto en Herbalife.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank. She lives in the Paute canton (Cuenca), an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.
Martha is 25, married, and has two children ages 2 and 4. Her husband is a driver, and drives a truck. They own their own home.

Martha takes care of their children and sells Herbalife products in her free time. She has been doing this for five years, and works every day of the week. She also supplies fruit to the markets, thanks to her husband and his truck.

This is her second loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in Herbalife natural products.

Her goal is to have a higher position in Herbalife.

loans.use: To buy Herbalife natural products.

loans.name: Diana Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Diana es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas (Cuenca), vive por el cantón Paute lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras Cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

La Señora Diana tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 4 años y 8 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como cocinero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, esta actividad la desempeña hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de  cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Diana is a member of the Pauteñitas (Cuenca) communal bank. She lives in the Paute canton, an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.

Diana is 23, married, and has one child who is four years and eight months old. Her husband works as a chef. They do not have their own home; they rent.

Diana has sold Herbalife products for three years. She works every day of the week without a fixed schedule. She also raises hogs.

This is her second loan in the communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of hogs and hog feed.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Santa Rosita - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La Sr. LUISA FRANCISCA de 37 años de edad madre soltera con 01 hijo menor de edad  de 11 años en etapa escolar, mujer luchadora  con los ánimos de salir adelante. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Santa Rosita – El Tambo”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropas vestidos para niños y adultos en su tienda comercial alquilada. El préstamo solicito para poder invertir en su negocio en comprar ropas vestidos para niños y adultos. La clienta Desea para el futuro comprar su propio Local en un centro comercial. La Sra. LUISA FRANCISCA se encuentra ubicada en la fotografía en la segunda persona, se encuentra en la parte derecha vestida con chompa color rosada y un pantalón color azul con rayas color celeste.  Las personas de parte superior de la fotografía son la Sra. Roció Sonia y la Sra. Roció Pilar se faltaron por motivo de salud.
texts.en:
Luisa Francisca, age 37, is a single mother of one 11-year-old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is a member of the “Santa Rosita – El Tambo” communal bank.
She sells clothing for adults and children in a store which she rents. She is requesting this loan to invest in her business through the purchase of clothing to sell. She wants to buy her own store in a shopping center in the future. She appears in the photo second from the right in the pink sweater. The people in the upper part of the photograph are Rocio Sonia and Rocio Pilar, who could not be present due to health reasons.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Santa Cruz - Concepcion Group

texts.es:
La Señora. JESSI AYDEE de 31 años de edad madre soltera con 02  hijo el  menor de edad  de 11 años en etapa escolar, mujer Profesional luchadora  con los ánimos de salir adelante.  Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Santa  Cruz - Concepción”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción que vende tuberías, fierros, cemento, clavos, etc. en una tienda alquilada. El préstamo solicito para la compra de materiales como  fierros, tubos polietilenos, accesorios, motor, etc. Así pueda invertir en su negocio y ahorrar. Desea en el futuro comprar su camioneta para trasladar sus materiales de negocio. 
La Sra. JESSI AYDEE chompa color blanco y un pantalón color negro es la primera persona  lado derecha de la fotografía a lado de la señora que viste con chompa color  rojo.
La personas de parte superior de la fotografía es la Sra. Alina Martha quien no pudo participar en la reunión por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jessi Aydee, age 31, is a single mother of two. Her youngest child is 11; school-aged. Jessi Aydee is a professional, hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead. She is a member of the Santa  Cruz - Concepción communal bank.
She sells construction supplies in a store which she rents. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies such as tools, polyethylene tubes, accessories, etc. With this loan, she will be able to invest in her business and save. In the future she wants to buy a truck to transport her merchandise. She is the first person on the right, wearing the white sweater.The person in the upper photo is Sra. Alina Martha, who could not be present for the meeting because of work obligations.

loans.use: with her hardware store, selling construction supplies.

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
La señora SONIA FLOR de 46 años de edad madre soltera con 03 hijo el  menor de edad  de 15 años en etapa escolar mujer emprendedora y  luchadora, con ánimos de salir adelante.  Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Mas Que Vencedores”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de Calzados para niño y adultos a base de materia prima de cuero su stand está localizado en el mercado de la localidad. El préstamo solicito para la compra de calzados y botines de material de cuero para niños y adultos. 
Desea en el futuro comprar otra galería comercial para la venta de calzados. Viste con polo color blanco y casaca color negro ubicada la primera persona lado derecha.
texts.en:
Sonia Flor, 46, is a single mother with three children.  The youngest is 15 years old and in school.  She is an enterprising woman, a fighter with the goal of getting ahead.  She is a member of Más Que Vencedores Communal Bank.  Currently she works selling shoes in her shopping center.

She requested the loan to buy leather shoes and boots for children and adults.  In this way she can invest in her business and save.  She wants to buy another shopping mall in the future for shoe sales.

She is wearing a white polo shirt and black jacket, the first person on the right side.

loans.use: to sell leather shoes and boots.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district, Sok is 46 years old and has 10 children. Six of them are workers at a rubber plantation factory while the other four are still in school. To feed her big family, she has been farming on her farm for nearly 30 years. Her husband is a homebuilder. Sometimes, Sok works for others to gain additional income and make a living. 

Sok leads a group of two female members. This will be her second loan. The first loan from VisionFund helped her establish a regular income and earn a better living. Now Sok is requesting another loan, which she will use to fix her farming machine and harvest her rice crops. 

Sok hopes to make more rice and earn more income to better feed her family as well as to keep her four children in school.

loans.use: To fix her farming machine and harvest her rice crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
A 55-year-old married mother, Saem has five children and only one of them is dependent. She lives in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district where cassava-planting is common. 

Saem has been farming on her rice field as her main income source for 30 years. She has supplemented her income by planting cassava for more than three years to raise additional income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. Her current daily income is more than $15 and she saves around $5 per day. 

This is Saem's first loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy cassava (starchy plant) from the village as stock for sale. This loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living as well as build her savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy cassava (starchy plant) from the village for sale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Seruni Indah Group

texts.en:
Fitri is 33 years old and married with two children. Her children are 10 years old and 8 years old and are going to school. She has been selling mie ayam (chicken noodle soup) since 2009 in front of her house. Her shop is always full of customers but she doesn't have a lot of seating space for them. So now she is taking her second loan from VisionFund Indonesia to purchase a table and chairs. Her husband works as a low-level employee at a nearby hotel but his salary is not enough to support all the needs of the family.

In the future, she hopes she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for a table and chairs for her food stall

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a food café business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Ezekiel dreams of expanding his business to meet the client demand.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase a stock of food, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice. He decided to join Yehu because of the flexible products offered.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of food, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent.

For the past year, George has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing the charcoal. He dreams of expanding and purchasing a plot in the future.

With the KES 20,000, George wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past three years, Titus has operated a cloth materials business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

Titus decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With 15000 KES, he wants to purchase cloth materials to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials to sell.

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca is a single mother of three children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Rabecca has operated a clothes business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a 10000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of two children who attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.  

For the past three years, she has sold clothes, door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary 37, is a married woman with two children, whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past two years, she has sold clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of establishing a stall to sell her products. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to start a new clothes selling business.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. 

The previous loan had a lot of impact upon her business and her family is now living a better life and her children are gaining a good education.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is taking out another Kiva loans of KES 10,000 to expand her business.  She anticipates an increase in demand during the festive season. 

Mwaris’s previous Kiva loan, helped her earn more profit and improve the her family's living standard.  She was able to purchase a pieces of land and she is now planning to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to renovate her house.  With the loan, she wants to purchase sand, cement and colorful paint to renovate her house. 

She dreams of expand her business to meet her customer's demands.  In the future she hopes to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and color paints to renovate the house.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a widowed mother of seven children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer's demands in the future.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to buy water pipes to install for her water selling business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to install for water selling business.

loans.name: Salimah

texts.en:
Salimah is a 63 year old married woman with nine children who are all grown ups.  Her husband is a businessman who supports the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses is food for her family. 

Salimah has operated a retail shop for the past two years and she also sells fish.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of transportation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil, all for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children; four attend school, while one is too young for school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Esther has operated a vegetable farm for the past three years; her potential clients are food stall owners in the local market.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other farmers.  She dreams of expanding her business and selling poultry and cattle.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new poultry business.  She decided to join Yehu to access capital for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her new poultry business.

loans.name: Mlae

texts.en:
Mlae is a married man with two school going children.  He owns a house with electricity but no piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Mlae has operated a fish selling business for the past four years; his potential clients are the area residents.  He faces a major challenge of fish bans by the government.  He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan he wants to purchase a freezer for storing his fish.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing his fish.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity.  His greatest monthly expense is food for himself.  

Joshua has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years.  His clients are local residents.  He faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities. He dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase more potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages for resale.  He decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is applying for another loan to expand her existing business.  She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more cereals for resale.  In the future, Bahati aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Bahati has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single lady who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Amina has operated a retail shop for the past year.  Her clients are neighbors and visitors.   She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Amina dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to purchase more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access working capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widowed woman with five children, four attend school while one is to young.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Gladys has operated a food stall for the past two years.  She is also a water vendor.  Her clients are neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.  Gladys dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar and also to build a shade cover for her water business.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar and also build a shade cover for her water business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachael is a 23 year old single lady who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Rachael has operated a boutique for the past year.  Her clients are neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Rachael dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more clothes for resale.  Rachael decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en: On January 1st, 2010	Saed, a 28-year-old married man from Gaza, opened his own salon. He is requesting this loan to buy chairs for cutting hair and hire someone to help him in the shop. Saed believes these measures will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy chairs for cutting hair and hire someone to help him in the shop.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 49 year old married man with 7 school going children. His wife is a tailor who contributes to the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Alphonce has operated a tailoring business for the past 20 years.  His clients are local residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Alphonce dreams of expand his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.  He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is applying for another loan to expand her existing business.  She will use this 80,000 Kes loan to purchase more bags of cement.  In the future, Mwanakombo aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Constance has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement for her business.

loans.name: Mwasabuni

texts.en:
Mwasabuni is applying for another loan to expand his business.  He will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase 100 kgs of scrap metal.  In the future, Mwasabuni aspires to continue improving his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Mwasabuni has greatly improved his family’s standard of living.  He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase 100 kgs of scrap metals for her business.

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is taking another Kiva loan of KES 10,000 to boost her business.  She anticipates an increase in demand during the festive season. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is a married man with eight children; six attend school.  His wife is a farmer and she contributes to the welfare of their family.  He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Masoud has operated a tailoring business for the past 15 years.  His clients are his neighbors.  He faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand.  He hopes to expand his business.

With the Kshs 45,000 loan, he wants to purchase more fabrics and embroideries for his business.  He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with three school going children.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the welfare of his family.  She lives in a rental house with piped water but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Peninah has operated a grocery for the past 10 years.  Her clients are her neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from point of purchase to her place of sale.  Peninah dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan Peninah wants to purchase more tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onion and carrots for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onion and carrots for resale.

loans.name: Madosho

texts.en:
Mwadosho is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop, selling door to door to his neighbors and passersby.  Mwadosho faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators.  He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.  Rehema dreams of purchasing an over-lock sewing machine in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Rehema wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a maize selling business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy cold season since maize plantations rot due to heavy rains. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school while four have graduated from secondary school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has operated a business selling goats for meat for the past two years, selling her goats in the market. One of the major challenges she faces is losses from livestock theft. She dreams of expanding the business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

With this loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children. One child attends school, while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Fatuma has operated a grocery-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges she faces is delayed payments from customers who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a family house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling clothes, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges she faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With this loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces high costs for transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and high transportation costs. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling in a shop to her neighbours. One of the major challenges she faces in the business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her retail shop to a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cassavas, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, cassavas, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single mother with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business, her potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other beauty salon operators. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her family’s living standard.
