With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other food stall operators. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase food items, bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items, bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children; one attends school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman with seven children; one attends school while the others graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a food café business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school. 
 
For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 32-year-old, married man, who lives in the Al-Jalazoon Refugee camp near Ramallah with his family of six.  
On May 1st, 2011, Ashraf opened his own dry-cleaning business. He now hopes that he will be able to buy a new high tech dry-cleaning machine with this loan, which will help him do his business at a faster pace. 
Because of this he will be able to please his customers and bring in new ones.

loans.use: to buy a new high tech dry-cleaning machine

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing electricity in her house in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high competition from other grocery operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bibi operates a cereal-selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers needs.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and green grams. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and green grams.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been operating a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the lack of enough goats for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers demands in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase goats for the sale of meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for the sale of meat.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with seven children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been operating a goatmeat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a motor vehicle garage in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase goats for the sale of meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for the sale of meat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to help renovate her rental houses. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cement, sand and color wall paints. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future and earn more income. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity to access loans to improve her mode of living.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cement, sand and color wall paints.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is taking another bigger loans of KES 100,000  to use in the construction of her house. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of sand, cement, timber and pay for labor. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sand, cement, timber and pay for labor.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru:
Эдуард – из Ивано-Франковска. Он работает на дому, предоставляя видеоуслуги, а именно видеосъемку, монтаж роликов и т.п. У Эдуарда огромный опыт работы на нескольких телестудиях. Он уже в этом бизнесе 11 лет. Отзывы о его работы – положительные – и со стороны клиентов, и со стороны специалистов. На данный момент его чистая прибыль составляет 3 000 гривен. 

Эдуард получает много заказов, но ему часто приходится отказывать потенциальным клиентам, так как он не может выполнить достаточно качественные видеоролики на имеющемся у него на данный момент оборудовании. Поэтому Эдуард планирует на полученные от КИВА средства приобрести профессиональную видеокамеру Panasonic HDC-MDH-1. Она ему необходима для записи видеороликов высокого качества. Имея эту профессиональную видеокамеру, Эдуард сможет не терять хорошие заказы, тем самым принося дополнительный доход в свою семью и дальше развивая свой бизнес. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Eduard is from Ivano-Frankivsk. He works from home, providing video services, such as making videos, editing clips etc... Eduard has extensive experience working in several  TV studios. He has been in this business for 11 years. He has received positive reviews for his work, both from customers and from experts in the field.  His current net profit is 3,000 hryvnia.   Eduard receives a lot of orders, but he often has to turn down potential customers because he cannot make high-quality videos with the equipment he owns at the moment.  With the funds that he will receive from Kiva, Eduard is planning to purchase a professional Panasonic HDC-MDH-1 camcorder which he needs to make high-quality videos.  With this professional camcorder, Eduard will no longer lose good orders.  He will also bring additional income to his family and further develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase a professional Panasonic HDC-MDH-1 camcorder.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера – вдова. У нее есть дочь-подросток, которую она воспитывала сама. Вера живет в Ивано-Франковске и занимается розничной торговлей парфюмерно-косметическими средствами и средствами гигиены. Она держит целых 3 торговых точки по городу, у нее 6 наемных работников и отдельный склад для товара. Вера раньше работала учителем английского языка, а ее супруг вел этот бизнес. После смерти мужа Вера была вынуждена взять управление бизнеса на себя. Вера установила сравнительно низкие цены на весь широкий ассортимент товарного ряда, ее точки очень выгодно расположены по всему городу. В бизнесе Вера уже занята 20 лет. 

Вера планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен в закупку парфюмерной продукции с целью расширения ассортимента перед праздниками. Закупив духи, одеколоны, туалетную воду, а также краски для волос, Вера надеется удовлетворить возрастающий спрос перед новогодними и рождественскими праздниками. Главная личная цель, которую ставит для себя Вера – оплатить образование дочери в ВУЗе.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vera is a widow. She has a teenage daughter, who she raised all by herself. Vera lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. She is engaged in retail trade in perfumes, cosmetics and hygiene products. She has as many as three sales points around the city, six employees, and a separate warehouse for the goods. In the past, Vera worked as an English teacher. After her husband's passing she had to take over his business. Vera set relatively low prices for the whole range of products; her vending stalls are conveniently located throughout the city. She has been in this business for twenty years. Vera plans to invest the Kiva loan of 20 000 hryvnas in the purchase of perfumes. She would like to increase the assortment before the holidays. She will buy perfumes, eau-de-cologne,  hair dyes, etc. in order to meet the increasing demand before the New Year and Christmas holidays. Vera's goal is to finance her daughter's college education.

Note: original text in Russian

loans.use: to buy perfume products in order to expand the assortment before the holidays

loans.name: Yelizaveta

texts.ru:
Елизавета замужем. У нее двое детей. Елизавета живет в селе Вышково. Она на пенсии, но денег почти всегда не хватает, вследствие чего решила начать торговать фруктами. Елизавета выращивает фрукты в своем саду и еще дополнительно закупает экзотические фрукты, которые потом перепродает, тем самым получая дополнительный доход. 

Елизавете необходимы дополнительные средства для личных нужд. Она делает дома ремонт и хочет поменять двери, но собственных средств на это не хватит. Елизавета планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 5 000 гривен на приобретение и установку новых дверей в своем доме, благодаря чему в доме будет теплее и уютнее в эту холодную пору года. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yelizaveta, who lives in Vyshkovo village, is married with two children. She is retired and is almost always in need. As a consequence, she started selling fruit which she grows in her orchard. She also buys exotic fruit that she resells at a profit, which provides additional income. 

Yelizaveta needs additional means for personal needs. She is renovating her house and would like to replace the old doors. Since she does not have enough money to do this, she is applying for a Kiva loan of 5 000 hryvnas. New doors will make the house warmer and cozier in this cold time of the year. 

Note: the original text is in Russian

loans.use: to replace the doors in her house

loans.name: Marelvis

texts.es: Marelvis es la propietaria de una peluquería ubicada al norte de la ciudad, donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal  a mujeres, niños y hombres en general;  allí mismo vende productos de belleza, accesorios femeninos y artículos de miscelánea en un local ubicado al lado de su vivienda.  Su negocio está muy bien equipado con muebles y enseres, que le permiten brindar un buen servicio, por eso ella genera ingresos importantes con los cuales apoya el bienestar de su hogar,  conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 18 años. En su pequeño almacén tiene de todo un poco de lo que su clientela requiere, ellos son vecinos del barrio, empleados de empresas, especialmente de uno de los  restaurantes más importantes de la ciudad, donde su esposo es el administrador y la apoya plenamente.  En la actualidad está planeando responder a la temporada de fiestas de final de año que se acerca, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr que su creciente clientela esté  totalmente satisfecha ; este es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos e insumos de belleza,  ropa, accesorios navideños de uso doméstico y personal para la venta; con esta mercancía su miscelánea tendrá los inventarios como lo exige la época decembrina y las familias,  clientes de Marelvis, responderán a sus necesidades en un lugar muy cercano a su vivienda; así mismo su inversión será exitosa, porque comprará en mayor volumen obteniendo descuentos, que trasladará a sus utilidades  y ofrecerá un servicio de excelencia, mejor del que está acostumbrado a entregar Marelvis a sus clientes.  En su negocio ella, maneja un margen de utilidad promedia de 58,78 %y rota sus inventarios cada 27 días, indicadores financieros   muy bueno para este tipo de negocios, que pretende aumentar inyectándole mas capital de trabajo como el que ofrece Kiva.
texts.en:
Marelvis is the owner of a beauty salon located in the north of the city where she offers services of personal-image improvement to women, children, and men in general.  There she also sells beauty products, feminine accessories, and general store items in a space located near her home.

Her business is very well equipped with furniture and equipment that allow her to offer a good service.  For this reason she generates important income with which she supports the well-being of her home, made up of her husband and their three children, ages 12 through 8.  In her little store she has everything, a little bit of what her customers need.  They are neighbors from the community, employees of businesses, especially of one of the most important restaurants of the city, where her husband is the manager and he supports her completely.

Currently she is planning to respond to the coming holiday season, but her working capital is insufficient to satisfy totally her growing clientele.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy beauty products and supplies, clothing, and Christmas accessories for home and personal use.

With this merchandise her shop will have the inventory demanded by the holiday season.  Also, the families, Marelvis's customers, will meet their needs very close to their homes.  At the same time her investment will be successful because she will buy wholesale and get discounts, which will transfer to her profits and she will offer an excellent service, better than what Marielvis is accustomed to delivering.

In her business she manages an average profit margin of 58.78% and turns over her inventory every 27 days--very good financial indicators for this type of business, which she is hoping to increase by infusing more working capital such as Kiva offers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies, clothing, and Christmas accessories for home and personal use.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustin de 46 años es un hombre que vive con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 26 años; él tiene un negocio a través del cual vende  y teje mecedoras  y jarrones  en mimbre, como sus líneas principales de productos. Su desempeño en este arte, es producto de una tradición familiar que trae desde  el departamento de Tolima, lugar ubicado en la región Andina, en el centro-occidente de Colombia,  y que  perfeccionó en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde trabajó como empleado de un amplio taller, que en el pasado cerró sus puertas y desde este momento, potencializó la apertura del suyo propio;  Agustín  distribuye sus productos  por toda la ciudad de Barranquilla en pequeños negocios y a la comunidad en general. Su meta de crecimiento depende de tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para invertir en materiales en mayor volumen y ganar buenos descuentos , y esto es justamente su razón para acceder a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materia prima e insumos para tejer y fabricar muebles y jarrones, aprovechando que se acerca la temporada de gran despliegue comercial, época en la cual sus clientes se provisionan y compran sus productos,  porque en el ambiente familiar reciben  primas y bonificaciones, y estos  la aprovecharán,  para darle curso libre a sus deseos e intereses familiares.  Su sueño es organizar su taller y generar empleos, además de tener  un almacén o punto de venta, donde exhiba el producto de su creatividad convertido en confort para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agustín, 46, is a man living with his spouse; he has five children whose ages range from 2 to 26.  He has a business where he sells and weaves rocking chairs and wicker urns which are his main product lines.  His work in this type of craft is a family tradition that he brings from the Department of Tolima a place located in the Andean part of Colombia and that he perfected in the city of Barranquilla where he was an employee in a large workshop which shut down operations some time ago and since then he opened up his own.

Agustín sells his wares throughout the city of Barranquilla to small businesses and to the community in general.  His growth goal depends on having sufficient working capital to invest in materials in larger amounts in order to qualify for discounts and this is precisely why he’s accessing a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he’ll use to buy raw materials and supplies to weave his furniture and urns taking advantage of the fact that the season when his customers stock up on merchandise and buy his products because families receive their bonuses and allowances that they use to let their family wishes and interests fly free.  

His dream is to organize his workshop and generate jobs as well as to have a warehouse or sales point to display the products of his creativity that are converted into comfort for his customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Neris

texts.es: Nerys de 65 años de edad  vive en el municipio de Soledad y se dedica a la preparación de alimentos, como picadas y comidas corrientes y especiales. Su negocio surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, pues es madre responsable de hogar; con ello ha logrado la educación de sus hijos, quienes se dedican también a la comercialización de hayacas, pasteles, picadas para  eventos especiales y fiestas familiares, apoyando a su madre. Ella además alterna este negocio, con la venta de mercancías que trae desde Sampués,  una población del departamento de Sucre en Colombia,  para venderla a clientes de Barranquilla y de Soledad en el departamento del Atlántico. Su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene por eso tiene 14 años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo, donde lleva 9 financiamientos, con los cuales ha logrado crecer como persona, desempeñarse efectivamente en su negocio y con ello aumentar su calidad de vida familiar, especialmente sus condiciones habitacionales y educativas de sus hijos.  En la actualidad está planeando acceder a su credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos de alimentos y muebles sampuesanos, (originarios de Sampués) para hacer su gran venta a finales del año, época en la cual hay mayor rotación de estas mercancías, por la gran demanda que tienen los clientes, quienes pagan buenas cuotas de créditos para obtener nuevos enseres para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nerys, 65, lives in the town of Soledad and prepares meals like picadas [snacks], daily menus and specials.  Her business arose from the need she had to earn income for her family because she’s a mother responsible for her home.  With it she’s managed to educate her children who help their mother also selling hayacas [a type of tamale], cakes and snacks for special events and family get-togethers.

In addition to this business she also sells merchandise that she brings from Sampués, a town in Sucre Department in Colombia, to sell in Barranquilla and in Soledad in Atlántico Department.  Her growth dream does not stop and this is why she’s been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 14 years.  She’s had 9 loans that have helped her grow as a person and to develop in her business and with this she’s increased her family’s quality of life especially with respect to her living spaces and her children’s education.

She is currently planning to access a Kiva loan to buy ingredients for her food preparation and furniture from Sampués for the great end of year sales, a season when merchandise turns over more because of increased customer demand who pay good payments to buy new things for their homes.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients and furniture from Sampués.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 33 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 8 años, en el municipio de Soledad, tierra de las butifarras, (embutidos artesanales) ubicada  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica al mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional de sus clientes, ofreciéndoles cortes de cabello, masajes, peinados, arreglo de uñas de las  manos y de los pies y tratamientos capilares,  que ella aprendió para emprender su propio negocio y generar ingresos importantes para el buen desempeño de su familia, desde hace seis años, en un local  que organizó   en su propia vivienda;    su primera clientela estaba conformada, por buenos vecinos, familiares y amigos cercanos, que aun conserva, y que diariamente son los responsables del incremento de su mercado. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento, va mas lejos  que sus posibilidades personales, pues su clientela aumenta  cada día y las necesidades de capital de trabajo de Sandra se hacen cada vez mas evidentes,  porque su propio dinero es insuficiente,  para atender la demanda de sus clientes, especialmente en la época de las fiestas familiares mas importantes del año, como las del mes de Diciembre. Esta es la razón por la cual accederá a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará productos de belleza, para provisionarse de insumos que requiere,  para ofrecer un buen servicio y también comprará mercancías variadas, como productos de bisutería y accesorios femeninos,  que son los productos de mas salida,  en la temporada mas alta que tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 33, lives with her spouse and two children, ages 2 and 8. They live in the Soledad municipality, home of the butifarras (specialty sausages). Soledad is located 15 minutes from Barranquilla. 
Sandra works to improve her clients' personal and professional images by offering haircuts, massages, hairstyling, manicures and pedicures, and hair treatments. She learned to do this so that she could open her own business and generate an important income for her family. She has been doing this for six years in a space that she outfitted herself in her own home. Her first customers were her neighbours, family and close friends. They still go to her, and refer more clients her way every day. Now, her business' potential to grow has exceeded what she is able to do on her own; her clientele is growing every day, so Sandra's need for working capital is becoming more and more evident. The money that she currently has is not enough to meet her customer demand, especially now that the most important holiday season is coming up: December. For this reason, she has turned to a Kiva loan. This is her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase beauty products in order to stock up on the tools that she needs. This will allow her to offer a good service. She will also buy varied merchandise, such as costume jewellery and women's accessories; these are her most popular products. This is her business' busiest season.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in order to stock up on the products that she needs in order to provide a good service. She will also buy varied merchandise, such as costume jewellery and women's accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to fill orders for items such as food and small home appliances.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 32 años es una comerciante natural, que vive al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 16 años. Ella emprendió su aventura de negocios desde hace 4 años con un financiamiento que recibió de una empresa que vende sus productos a través de guías especializadas, con la que adquirió su código  y empezó a vender cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, joyas en plata y sus derivados. Muy pronto su negocio fue creciendo, porque el producto de sus ganancias lograba invertirlo en él,  apoyada por su cónyuge, quien le ha ayudado en los momentos de mayor desafío que se presentaron al iniciar, porque su capital de crédito no lo recuperaba tan pronto como ella esperaba. Luz Marina sueña con el crecimiento la expansión de su negocio y esta es la razón por la cual acude a aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina pequeña y productos cosméticos que vinieron en la oferta de fin de año, con los cuales la surtirá y en el momento de mayor volumen de ventas como navidades y año nuevo, hará, la mejor exhibición de ellos y así mismo la mejor venta del año. Los indicadores financieros de su negocio lo muestran como rentable y con mucho potencial de crecimiento de acuerdo con su característica,  pues maneja una utilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 34%, indicador  desde donde parte,  para continuar con el ascenso de las ventas esperadas, contando con un nuevo capital e trabajo como el que ofrece su credikiva..
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 32, is a natural merchant living in southwest Barranquilla with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 16 years.  She started her adventure in business four years ago with a loan she got from a firm that sells the products she sells via catalogue.  With it she purchased a code and started selling cosmetics, women’s accessories, silver jewelry and derivatives.  Very soon her business started to grow because she would reinvest her profits into it and being supported by her spouse who has helped her during the times of greatest challenge she faced at the beginning because she would not recuperate her credit capital as fast as she had planned to.

Luz Marina dreams with her business’ growth and expansion and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a small display case and cosmetics that are on sale for the end of year that she’ll use to stock up to be ready for the season of highest sales at Christmas and New Years; she will be able to display them better and have the best sales of the year.

Financial indicators show her business to be profitable and with much growth potential according to its characteristics because she currently has a profit margin of 34%, an indicator from which she starts to continue raising her expected sales having new working capital from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a small display case and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad, allí se dedica a la venta de películas  y también ofrece los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras,  desde hace 2 años en su propio apartamento,  a vecinos del sector y de sus aledaños,  con una frecuencia de ventas diarias y  de contado, con lo que obtiene un margen de utilidad no menor del 50% . Su idea emprendedora inició cuando compró su DVD, con un televisor y sus amigos y vecinos se reunían en su casa para ver y alquilaban películas; así fue como pidió a su esposo poner  el aviso de alquiler y  venta de películas,  con el que le ha ido muy bien,   posteriormente agregó a esta clientela doméstica el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, que había conocido por experiencia de su madre.  Sus dos negocios  le han permitido generar ingresos,  con los que ha apoyado el bienestar de su hogar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 2 lavadoras mas,  con ellas ampliará su potencial de acceso al mercado y responderá a la de manda de su clientela que muchas veces se va sin el servicio resuelto, porque sus lavadoras están ocupadas en varios sectores del barrio. Rosa se ha caracterizado por ser una persona que le gusta ahorrar, por eso no le fue difícil tener su primer capital de trabajo y hacer su primera inversión en el emprendimiento de su microempresa. Hoy se siente muy satisfecha y con ganas de continuar el crecimiento de su negocio y por eso se esmera en su trabajo diario, porque está construyendo el futuro de su hijo y espera que este tenga buenas posibilidades educativas, para que tenga la potencialidad de ser exitoso en lo que el decida emprender.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, lives with her spouse and six-year-old son to the south of the city, where she works selling movies.  Also, for two years she has been offering a service from her own apartment renting washing machines to neighbors in her neighborhood and nearby.  With a frequency of daily sales and installments, she gets a profit margin of no less than 50%.

She started her enterprising idea when she bought her first DVD player.  With her friends and neighbors and a television set they would get together in her house and rent movies to watch.  This is how she asked her husband to put up the announcement of renting and selling movies, which has gone very well for her.  Later she added to her domestic clientele the service of renting washing machines, which she had known about through her mother's experience.  Her two businesses have allowed her to generate income, with which she has supported the well-being of her home.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first funding she has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy two more washing machines, with which she will expand her potential for accessing the market and she will respond to her customers' demand, which often goes away unmet because her machines are busy in various areas of the neighborhood.

Rosa has described herself as a person who likes to save.  This is why it was not difficult for her to get her first working capital and make her first investment in the entrepreneurship of her small business.

Today she feels very satisfied and wants to continue the growth of her business.  For this reason she does her best in her daily work, because she is building her son's future and she wants him to have good educational possibilities, so he will have the potential to be successful in what he decides to undertake.

loans.use: to buy two more washing machines to expand her access to market potential.

loans.name: Yeimy

texts.es: Yeimy de 19 años es una joven muy emprendedora,  que tiene un hijo en la edad de 1 año,  con el que sueña ver crecer lleno de bienestar y con las mejores condiciones de vida, que ella en  su inagotable esfuerzo,  pueda ofrecerle. En su condición de mujer cabeza de familia, Yeimy  genera ingresos mediante una actividad comercial, a través de la cual vende mercancías cosméticas, accesorios,  ropa etc, mediante guías especializadas de productos. Ella siempre tiene a la mano el catalogo, pues está dispuesta a conseguir un cliente en cada persona con la que habla o a la que conoce; con su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y su motivación por surgir es inmensa, pues el futuro de su hijo está en sus manos, él es el gran motor de su impulso comercial y la resolución de sus necesidades  no dan espera. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el l comprará productos que en este mes de Diciembre han llegado en su catalogo, con unos importantes descuentos,   impactando a sus clientes, como perfumes, champos, colonias, desodorantes, labiales, bases y otros productos capilares.  A sus clientes desea complacer y lograr con ello, su meta de  venderles y de ganar un poco mas de dinero, para continuar capitalizándose. Yeimi es una mujer progresista que está estudiando una carrera técnica, con la que planea grandes éxitos,  para si misma que irradien a su hijo.  Su desafío más grande es el poco capital con el que cuenta,  para continuar el crecimiento empresarial  soñado, por eso se esmera en lograr que sus productos, roten cada vez más rápido y sus cuentas por cobrar también. En la actualidad obtiene una rentabilidad no menor del 40%,  importante para el buen desempeño de este tipo de negocios, que muestra un potencial crecimiento  con el capital de trabajo nuevo,  producto del apoyo de su credikiva actual y que en el  futuro también planea obtener.
texts.en:
Yeimy, 19, is a young entrepreneur who has a 1-year-old son.  She dreams with seeing him grow up filled with wellbeing and with the best possible living conditions that she can offer through her untiring effort.

In her condition as a female head of household, Yeimy earns income through a commercial activity through which she sells cosmetics, accessories, clothing, etc. via specialized catalogues.  She always has a catalogue at hand because she’s willing to win over a customers from every person she meets or talks to.  With her business she’s managed to get ahead and her motivation to surge forward is immense because her son’s future is in her hands.  He is the great motivator of her commercial impulse and meeting his needs can’t wait.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan which is also her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy products like perfume, shampoo, cologne, deodorant, lipstick, foundation and other hair products that are in the December catalogue and have important discounts that impact her customers.  She wants to please her customers this way.

Yeimy is a progressive woman who is studying a technical career that she plans great successes for herself that will reflect on her son.  Her greatest challenge is the little capital she has to continue with her dreamed for business growth.  This is why she strives to sell her products quickly so that they turnover more quickly each time as well as her accounts receivable.  She currently has a profit margin of no less than 40% which is important for this type of business’ development which shows a potential for growth with new working capital from her current Kiva loan and the ones she plans to get in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba de 55 años es una mujer que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y vende productos derivados de la harina de trigo como,  pasabocas empanadas y deditos; ella hace 9 años inició su negocio en la ciudad de Valledupar, departamento del Cesar,  donde aprendió todo lo relacionado con su emprendimiento, en los aspectos técnicos y en el mercado. Cuando se radicó en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lo primero que hizo fue hacer una preventa y ofrecer  sus productos en tiendas, hospitales del barrio, empresas y a la comunidad de amas de casa en general, logrando conseguir clientes, con los aun hoy cuenta, porque se esmera en ofrecer productos de calidad, a un buen precio y en condiciones de frescura y calidad inigualable.  Su meta mas adelante, es ampliar su infraestructura, dotarse de maquinarias y enseres para tecnificar sus procesos y finalmente lograr tener su propia casa. En la actualidad su mayor desafío, es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograr el crecimiento gradual esperado y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará una maquina cilindradora, con el fin de amasar con mayor efectividad  y aumentar su productividad, aprovechando especialmente la época de Diciembre, que contiene fiestas familiares, donde el consumo de estos productos se incrementa y con ello Alba se daría a conocer aun mas y ampliaría  su potencial de ventas. Su utilidad actual es del 35% y está de acuerdo con este tipo de negocios, que desde ahora y  con el impulso de su mercado,  muestra un potencial de crecimiento que le permitirá aumentar sus utilidades y así mismo su nivel de bienestar, siendo apoyado con capital de financiamiento como el que le ofrece su credikiva..
texts.en:
Alba, 55, is a woman living in the city of Barranquilla; she sells products derived from wheat flour like snacks, turnovers and deditos [finger cookies].  She started her business nine years ago in the city of Valledupar, Cesar Department, where she learned everything related to this enterprise both technically and marketwise.

When she moved to Barranquilla the first thing she did was conduct a presale and offer her products to stores, neighborhood hospitals, firms in the community and housewives in general thereby acquiring customers which she still has to this day because she strives to produce quality products that are fresh and of unequalled quality and are sold at good prices.  Her goal for later on is to expand her infrastructure, acquire machinery and appliances to mechanize her processes and in the long run acquire a house of her own.  

Currently, her biggest challenge is the little working capital she can count on to reach the desired growth and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy a rolling machine to knead the dough more efficiently and increase productivity to take advantage of the December season that contains family festivities where consumption of her products increases and Alba will be able to be more widely known and her sales potential will expand accordingly.

Her present profit margin is 35% which is in accord with this type of business which from now with impulse from her market shows growth potential that will allow for increased profits as well as the her wellbeing level being supported financially with capital from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a rolling machine.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is from Maloro, Tangub City. She is a 43-year-old, married, and with five adult children.

Catalina owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with one child and Helen is 40 years old. She resides at Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Helen is operating a motorcycle transportation business in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for tuition fees for her child. Helen became a member of GDMPC in this year. In the future, Helen wants to have her own house and lot.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is widow with three children. Maria Fe is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maria Fe is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and every month she earns 8,500 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 16,870 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service.

Maria Fe has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Maria Fe hopes to see her children finish their studies and to earn double the income out of her business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Laurente

texts.en:
Laurente is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Laurente is married and has four school-aged children.

To make a living, Laurente owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Laurente has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Laurente is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional motorcycle.

In 2004, Laurente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en: Flordelita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Flordelita has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is also selling electronic loads of SUN CELLULAR. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Flordelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flordelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Edith has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman who has one child. Leonila is 32 years old and resides in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Leonila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members, and she's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 pesos doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 pesos to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Leonila has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Leonila wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Jonalyn has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 pesos to buy vegetables to sell. Jonalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Raquel has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ordaly

texts.en:
Ordaly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Ordaly has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ordaly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ordaly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra, 54, is a widow with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She plants, harvests and sells fruit to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

 Isidra has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Marissa has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mydee requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for maintenance. She has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Mydee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 38 years old and married with five children. With all five children in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Melba has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, spices, eggs, canned goods, etc.

In the future Melba would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Merluville

texts.en:
Merluville is married with two children. She is 25-years-old, and lives in the Philippines.

Merluville is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven months, and every month she earns 5,000.00 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 40,000.00 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Merluville has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Merluville hopes to own a house and the lot.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 51 years old and her husband, Leav, is 54 years old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have four children, including three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, and the other two are in school. 

Rim sells beef and vegetable soup at her home, while her husband is a vet. In addition, the couple grows rice. Rim is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

In the photo, Rim is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Merlinda is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business raising crops, planting, and harvesting for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old, and has 10 children, three of whom are in school. Florencia is married. 

Florencia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

Florencia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y, pictured above, is 42 years old.  His wife, Rortyas, aged 44, lives with him in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991, and have three sons and two daughters. One has full-time employment, and the others attend school.  

Y is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver and is also a fisherman. His wife sells fish that her husband catches in local market. Y is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 USD to purchase a boat motor.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor.

loans.name: Anifel

texts.en:
Anifel is 29 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Anifel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Anifel has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Anifel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en:
Nasy (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Hoeurn, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991 and have six sons - two are construction workers, three attend school, and one is a monk.
  
Nasy is a silk weaver, while her husband sells cows and does construction work. In addition, they grow rice for food. Nasy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She will also use part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from Dalapang, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business raising crops. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 6,800 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan (pictured here) is single and lives with her brother and sisters and widowed father in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her father is a farmer and raises cows at home. 


Nan is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $400 to help her sister who is a weaver by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her sister’s weaving business.

loans.name: Keatha

texts.en:
Keatha (pictured here) and his wife, Naren, live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two young sons.

The couple has been farming for five years. They grow rice and vegetables. In addition, Keatha is a fisherman. 

Keatha is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice and vegetable farm and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi (pictured above) and her husband, Man, have been married since 2000 and have four children, including three sons and one daughter. Two are attending school and other two are still young. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Safi's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

Safi's husband is a fisherman. Safi sells fish that her husband catches in local market. When her husband is free from fishing, the couple also runs a business selling recycling materials. In the past, Safi sold clothes, but she transferred the business to her mother.

Safi is asking for another loan in the amount of $800 to purchase more fishing nets for her husband and provide capital to help her mother buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets for her husband and provide capital to help her mother buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Borann

texts.en:
Borann, age 45, is a motor taxi driver.  His wife, Saros, age 27 (pictured together) does housework at home. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have one young son.

Borann is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to lay bricks and plaster the wall of a concrete room under his wooden house in order to visually enhance it. He will also use a part of the loan to make a new stairway of his house.

loans.use: To lay bricks and plaster the wall of a concrete room under his wooden house in order to visually enhance it and make a new stairway in his house.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a married man having five children. He is 45 years old and resides at Sinusa, Ozamis City: Philippines. 

Rufino owns and operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and has been three years in this business. Each month, he earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rufino has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Rufino wants to make improvements of his house and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (in the photo), age 32, is a garment worker and her husband, Limy, age 36, has full-time employment. They have been married since 2007 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. Two attend school and another one is just baby. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phalla is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to make new windows and a stairway in her house because they are old. She will use another part of the loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband.  The motorcycle will help her husband to get work because the old motorbike breaks very often, is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes.

loans.use: To make new windows and stairway of her house and buy a new motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 31 years old and a hairdresser.  Her husband, Phea, who is also 31 years old, is a barber.  They have two children, one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other is still young.  They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

In addition, the couple operates a business, renting space in their house. They plan to build one more room in order to respond to their customer’s needs.  Therefore, Navy is requesting a loan in the amount of $300.

loans.use: To build one more room to rent.

loans.name: Virgillia

texts.en:
Virgillia is a widow. Virgillia is 53 years old and resides at Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Virgillia owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living, and she's been 30 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Virgillia is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Virgillia wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Wilfreda is married and has six adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a business venture, providing repair services to local community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Wilfreda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. In 2010, Wilfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, a widow with four children, is 58 years old and lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, for the past 30 years Felicitas has been planting and harvesting bananas for sale, earning PHP3,000 each month.

A member of GDMPC for one year, Felicitas is requesting a loan of PHP7,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Magdalina has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables.

Magdalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Magdalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
This is Shierly, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Thomas, a farmer, and she is a mother to their four children. By the grace of God, Shierly has managed to support her children's schooling. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Shierly makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She plants different kinds of ornamental plants in her garden. In the Philippines, Filipinos love to arrange different plants for the beautification of their homes and backyard. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbours and the nearby community. She’s been ten years in this business. She earns a minimum of Php335 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php 18,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, wires and plastic. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  And she hopes to send all her children all the way to college. 

Shierly hopes to grow her business in the coming years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Annaliza has a shop that sells green leafy vegetables like "kangkong" & "alugbati". She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Annaliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Teresita is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance & pay for gasoline.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools  for maintenance & pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 
Emeliana has a shop that sells food seasonings & coconut wine in repacked. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasonings & gallon of coconut wine.
Emeliana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emeliana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings & gallon of  coconut wine

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Аъзамджон занимается скотоводством. Он целеустремленный и добросовестный семьянин. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Аъзамджон хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия и расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях семьи. Также он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Отходы сельхозкультур идут на корм скота. Он хотел бы получить займы в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки одного  крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелко рогатого скота.
texts.en: Azamjon raises livestock.  He is a goal oriented and honest family man.  He is married and has three children.  Azamjon would like to improve his living conditions and to grow his business in order to support his family in good conditions.  He also grows agricultural crops.  The waste from crops is used to feed the livestock.  He would like to take out a loan of 3,000 Somoni in order to purchase one head of cattle and 2 heads of small livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Fresie

texts.en:
Fresie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Fresie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Fresie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fresie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Alicia has a shop that sells food seasonings, spices & vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell.
Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 59, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her only child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lydia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Lydia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and products for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lydia hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Letecia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Elaisa Mae

texts.en:
Elaisa Mae  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Elaisa Mae  has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elaisa Mae  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elaisa Mae  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Arcelli

texts.en:
Arcelli is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Arcelli has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.
Arcelli has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Arcelli hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina, a 52-year-old resident of Taguig City, Philippines, is married to Domingo, a salesman, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her retail business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Martina operates a buy-and-sell business, purchasing general merchandise from wholesalers, then selling it for a small profit. Her products are footwear, sandals and other such products. Attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many choices she offers, Martina's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operation of her business, Martina is requesting a Php40,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of sandals and slippers to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Martina dreams of having a permanent store in the future and hopes to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of slippers and sandals needed in her business.

loans.name: Bukhchuluun

texts.en: Now he needs to increase his store working capital for the more sales volume in the further. It is important and beneficial for his business future. Therefore the loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the large amount of groceries for increasing the working capital of his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase the large amount of groceries for increasing the working capital of his grocery store.

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntungalag, 36 is a hairdresser. She has been working as a hairdresser for many years. She lives with her son in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Lately her apartment has become very uncomfortable and cold to live. Because all the window insulation have removed and there is too much heat-loss during the winter time.  Therefore she needs to make adjustment and insulation to the windows of her home immediately.  The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Delgermaa, 27 studies Korean and has the translation business. She lives with her husband and her daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Delgermaa usually makes the interpretation by USD 5-7 in an hour and sometimes her job line is cut during many days.  She has been doing her business for 4 years. Also she studies in the advanced level course of Korean. 
She requested a loan to purchase the new notebook for her translation job. Because the notebook is a main works tool of her business and she uses it for her translation jobs and her studies. Her old previous notebook had damaged 2 weeks ago. During the past 2 weeks her business has been stopped among. Therefore she needs to purchase the new one. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the notebook for her studying of Korean. It is absolutely important to her language studying and her future business career.

loans.use: To purchase the notebook for her studying of Korean

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 34-year-old married woman with two children aged 9 and 2. Ana Marie’s husband works as a sales clerk in one of the pharmacies in Tagbilaran, City Bohol.

Ana Marie runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Sikatuna, Bohol where her family lives. She sells canned goods, shampoo, soap and other kinds of products. Ana Marie has run out of products to sell and has no capital left. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo and soap. She also plans to join Boardwalk, a direct sales company.

In the future, Ana Marie hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been making candles for two years. She is 45 years old, married with eight children.

Helen sells her candles to store owners in her town. She is able to help her husband buy their basic needs such as food and clothes. Helen works hard to improve her income and be able to send all her children to school.

Helen has requested this loan to purchase wax, cans, wicks and other materials for making candles.

loans.use: to purchase wax, cans, wicks and other materials for making candles

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is a basket maker from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married and has seven children. Fernanda’s husband works as a driver and mechanic.

Aside from making baskets, Fernanda also sells food items such as rice cakes and "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick). She works hard to help send her children to school. She requested this loan to buy rattan and raw ingredients such as oil, bananas and rice. Fernanda hopes to have enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rattan and raw ingredients such as oil, bananas and rice.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 39-year-old married woman with 10 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Evangeline’s husband is a carpenter.

Evangeline has been making baskets for five years. She is able to help support her family through her business. She requested this loan to purchase rattan and other materials for making baskets. Evangeline hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rattan and other materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Cecilia’s husband works as a farmer.

Cecilia has been in the business of raising hogs for about 20 years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs. Cecilia hopes this loan will help her business and family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs.

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством, на данный момент имеет 7 голов коров и 8 голов овец. Он выполняет всю тяжелое работу, чтобы дать образование своим детям. Султонкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он очень трудится и все его старания приносят ему стабильный доход и дают возможность продвигаться вперед. Султонкул планирует на полученную прибыль сыграть свадьбу сына. Все его планы требуют усердного труда и расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он хотел бы купить 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Для этого он просит  вас помочь ему в осуществлении его планов. Он планирует после женитьбы сына открыть ему отдельный бизнес для самостоятельного ведения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sultonkul is married and is a responsible father of 2 children. He has been working in cattle breeding for over 20 years and currently owns 7 cows and 8 sheep. He is doing all the hard labor so that he can provide education for his children. Sultonkul wants to expand his business and get good income. He is working hard and his efforts will provide him a stable income and will allow him to move ahead. Sultonkul is planning to use the income to pay for his son's wedding. All his plans require hard work and business expansion. In order to do that he would like to purchase 2 additional heads of cattle. His is asking for your help in realizing his plans. He is planning to open a separate business for his son after the wedding.

loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, 52, raises pigs for a living. She has been engaged in this kind of business for quite some time now. Avelina said she is able to help her husband provide for their needs through raising pigs. 

Avelina has requested a loan to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins. Avelina hopes to have a stable income that would help her send her three children to school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is a married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has three children, age 17, 10 and 5. Herminigilda’s husband works as a driver.

Herminigilda makes candles to earn a living. She has been in this kind of business for a year. She earns 3,000 PHP per month with this business.

Herminigilda has requested a loan to buy wax, wicks, cans and other materials for making candles. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks, cans and other materials for making candles.

loans.name: Yulduzoi

texts.ru: Юлдузой энергичная женщина, ей 36 лет. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Юлдузой занимается купле продажей крупного рогатого скота.
