Она всю прибыль старается правильно распределить. Уделяет также много времени для воспитания детей. Она старается создать все условия для получения образования своих детей. Более 12 лет она трудится и продвигается вперед. Она четвертый раз кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» и от ранее полученных займов получила  хорошую прибыль. На прибыль купила мебель для своего дома. Теперь она хочет еще немножко улучшить свои жилищные условия и для этого ей необходимо расширить свой бизнес. Юлдузой запрашивает займ для покупки одной коровы и 2 голов овец. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Yulduzoi is an energetic 36-year old woman. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Yulduzoi raises and sells cattle. She allocates her profits carefully for various needs and spends a lot of time raising her children as well. It is very important for Yulduzoi to create an environment where her children will receive the best education and move on to a better life. Her livestock business has been going for more then 12 years and Yulduzoi had turned to "Imon International" four times already. The loans have been fully repaid and she was able to earn good profits from these ventures. Yulduzoi used the money to purchase new furniture and is planning to continue improving her family's living conditions in the future. Furthermore she wants to expand her herd again and is requesting this loan to purchase another cow and two more sheep. Yulduzoi is hoping for your support and would like to thank everyone in advance for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Chadyl

texts.en:
Chadyl is from Monte Alegre, Aurora, ZDS. She is 28 years old. Chadyl is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Chadyl operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale. Chadyl has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,680 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2010, Chadyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Chadyl is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children, ages 13 to 32. 

Juliet has been in the business of raising hogs for five years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month with her business.

Juliet has requested a loan to buy more piglets to raise. 

Juliet plans to start an additional business, which is selling firewood. Juliet hopes to succeed in her ventures.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old and married. She has four children. 

She has been making and selling charcoal for 15 years. Leonora works hard and is able to support her husband in providing for their needs through this business. 

Leonora has requested a loan to buy more coconut shells and wood to make charcoal. Leonora hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells and wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 31, earns a living selling barbecue to her community. She started this business eight months ago. Lolita sells chicken and pork barbecue. She also sells hotdogs on sticks. Lolita earns about 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy pork and chicken meat, sticks, soy sauce and charcoal.

Lolita works hard to support her family of a husband and two children, ages 10 and 6. Lolita hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, sticks, soy sauce and charcoal.

loans.name: Urishboy

texts.ru: Уришбой отец шестерых детей, женат, ему 58 лет. Сам занимается откормом и продажей скота. А также имеет доход с воскресного базара, где перепродаёт скот. Сейчас у него 6 баранов , и на получаемый кредит он хочет купить два мешка корма для них. Он ответственный и пунктуальный клиент в «Арванде».
texts.en: Urishboy is a married 58-year-old man with six children.  He is engaged in livestock fattening and sales.  Urishboy also resells the livestock at a farmers market, which is an additional source of income for his family.  As of today, Urishboy has 6 sheep.  He wants to get a loan to buy two sacks of feed for his sheep.  Urishboy is known to be a responsible and punctual client at MDO Arvand, LLC.

loans.use: To buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with six children. Elsie is 39 years old, residing at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Elsie owns and operates a coconut production venture to earn a living and she has been 21 years in this business. Each month, she earns 45,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Elsie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Elsie wants to make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Zuro

texts.ru: Занятие бизнесом в сельском хозяйстве и животноводстве  требует большого труда и усилий. Это работа на открытом воздухе под солнцем и дождем, без всяких условий труда, это перегон скота с одного пастбища на другое. Осознавая этот тяжелый труд, Зуро посвятила себя сельскохозяйственному бизнесу. Вот  уже более 8 лет она занимается данным видом бизнеса. У Зуро дружная семья, муж и 2 детей. Она старается для обеспечения детей во всем поддержать мужа. Она запрашивает займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и очень нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Farming and raising livestock in the country takes a lot of work and dedication. The work is always done outside in the sun and rain, without any comforts, especially when the herd has to be moved from one pasture to another. Knowing how hard it is to be a rancher, Zuro has still dedicated herself to this business. She has been raising livestock for the last eight years. Zuro has a good and tight-knit family: her husband and two children. She tries to help her husband to provide for their offspring. For this reason Zuro is requesting a loan to purchase two more calves so that she can expand her herd. She is hoping for your help and is in great need of your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 53 years old and is a married woman with two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Martina makes baskets for a living. She buys dried buri (a type of palm tree) to make baskets. Martina works hard to improve her income and sustain her family. 

She requested this loan to purchase more buri to make baskets. Martina hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more buri to make baskets.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has two children. Rosemarie is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosemarie is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earns 18,893 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Rosemarie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia, 48, makes baskets for a living. Her baskets are made of "nito" (a tropical vine). Melecia has been in this business for 15 years. She works hard to make her products of good quality.

Melecia has requested this loan to purchase nito and other materials to make baskets. She hopes to earn better and be able to send her two children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nito and other materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Meda

texts.en:
Meda is from La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. Meda is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Meda is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Meda has been in her business for over 6 months and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Meda is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2011, Meda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.ru: Кароматулло проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 22 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кароматулло занимается торговлей тканей у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Karomatullo lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 22 years old. He is married. He has two children. Karomatullo sells fabric from home. He has been doing this work for four years. He is taking a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old, a married woman with two children. One of them is in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Alice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nescil

texts.en:
Nescil is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 23 years old. Nescil is a single mom and has one child. 

To make a living, Nescil operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Nescil has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 13,710 PHP a month for these activities. 

Nescil is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. In 2011, Nescil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.ru: Исломидин более 7 лет занимается производством кирпичных блоков. Работниками являются двое членов семьи и имеет еще двоих работников. Его бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход. С прибыли он купил аппарат по производству  кирпичных блоков. Его бизнес расширяется, и он хочет нанять еще двоих работников. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки цемента и гравий для производства кирпичных блоков.
texts.en: Islomiddin has been producing building bricks for the last seven years. Two members of his family work at the brick making plant and Islomiddin employs two more workers as well. This business has been yielding steady profits and Islomiddin was able to buy a new brick making machine. This purchase allowed him to increase production and he is hoping to hire two more workers for his plant. Islomiddin is requesting this loan to purchase cement and gravel to make more bricks.

loans.use: To buy cement and gravel

loans.name: Donik

texts.ru:
Доник родился 1956 г. в городе Капане, окончил среднюю школу в деревне Севакар, а после окончание школы поступил и окончил Капанский горный техникум, где получил специальность электромеханика. В данный момент Доник работает электриком.
Доник женат и у него четверо детей: три сына и дочь. Дочь и старший сын имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Средний и младший сыновья живут вместе с родителями.
Параллельно с работой электриком, Доник занимается сельским хозяйством уже почти 20 лет. В деревне Севакар у него есть небольшой участок земли, на котором он выращивает овощи и фрукты, разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию Доник реализует в городе Капане. Жена и два сына помогают Донику в сельскохозяйственной деятельности, благодаря чему они содержат семью и ежедневно обеспечивают ее необходимыми свежими продуктами.
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Донику для приобретения двух коров и трех телят, что поможет ему в будущем увеличить доход своей семьи. Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Доником от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en: Donik was born 1956 in the city of Kapan.  He finished a secondary school in the Sevakar village, and then, after finishing school, was accepted and graduated from the Kapan Mining College, where he obtained a profession of an electrician.  Currently, Donik works an electrician.  Donik is married and has four children: three sons and a daughter.  His daughter and oldest son already have their own families and live separately from the parents.  The middle and youngest sons live with the parents.  Parallel to his electrician work, Donik has been involved in agriculture for almost 20 years.  He has a small plot of land in the Sevakar village, where he grows vegetables and fruits and breeds cattle and chickens.  Donik sells his agricultural products in the city of Kapan.  His wife and two sons help Donik with the agricultural business, thanks to which they support the family and provide it daily with the necessary, fresh products.  Donik needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram to purchase two cows and three calves, which would help him to increase his family's income in the future.  This is Donik's third loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and three calves

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a married woman with two children. Marlita is 53 years old and resides at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Marlita owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living and she's been one year in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Marlita is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Marlita wants to build house and to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
A very hard-working entrepreneur, Corazon is 61 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Corazon has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

Corazon has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Trupesa

texts.en:
Trupesa is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. For five years now, she has been operating a charcoal-selling business in Yei, South Sudan.

Trupesa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase additional charcoal. She will use any additional income she generates from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 47-year-old, married woman. She has two children: one is 22 years old, and the other is 13 years old.

For ten years, she has been operating a sari-sari (general) store business. At her store, Nelia sells canned goods, chips and various other products, and she cooks food to sell to her customers. Nelia explains that she does her best to support her family.

Nelia has requested a loan to buy additional meat, vegetables and other items to sell, including canned goods and soft drinks. Nelia hopes to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, vegetables and other items (e.g., canned goods and soft drinks) to sell.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is a 62-year-old woman from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Felecitas is a widow with two children.

To earn a living, Felecitas runs a general store, where she sells a variety of food and everyday products (including candy, cigarettes, shampoo, and soap) to members of her local community. Felecitas explains that she has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and that she earns approximately 4,600 PHP per month from these activities.

Felecitas is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items so that she can expand her product offerings. In 2008, Felecitas joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services, which enabled her to improve the business and her living situation. She plans to save any additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to increase inventory by purchasing additional items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. Milagros is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Milagros explains that she has been in this business for 10 years.

Milagros is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 40-year-old, married woman with one child living in the Philippines.

Helen is in the agriculture business. Specifically, she raises pigs.

Helen is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Helen explains that she has been raising pigs for three years now, and that she has already borrowed three loans through NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Helen would like to save money so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ceperina

texts.en:
Ceperina is 56 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ceperina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ceperina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Vevilita

texts.en:
Vevilita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad (or "pedicab") transport business in the Philippines. 

Vevilita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad business. She has been in this business for 10 years. Vevilita earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.  She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Vevilita dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad (or "pedicab") transport business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old and a widow.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Delia has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 30-year-old, married woman with two children, both of them are in school. Esther has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for 3 years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and a widow with 9 children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products for her sari-sari store. Basilisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Basilisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 20-year-old woman. She’s single, living with her one parent and two working siblings. Her father is the main source of income in the family in addition to her siblings who contribute in covering the family expenses. 

As for Dina, she started to sell cosmetics products in 2009 from her home and has customers from all over the neighbor areas; they do believe in her beautiful and fashionable style. Today, she wants to borrow 800 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added beauty products such as lipsticks, blush and many other items, which will help her attract more customers and therefore increase her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty shop and improve her performance.

loans.use: buy added beauty products such as lipsticks, blush and many other items

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old and married with one child.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Cristina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Cristina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and two children. She cooperates with her husband who has been working as a soldier in the Lebanese army and he’s now benefiting from his retirement compensation.  

As for Hiyam, she has been teaching private lessons from her home for the past 10 years. Today, she’s asking for a loan of 1,100 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a library for her education room. She notes that this will help her arrange her books in a proper way. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a library for her education room

loans.name: Mandalin

texts.en:
Mandalin is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She operates a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan and has been in business for two years.

Mandalin is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 29-year-old married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. At this time, she has no children.

Norberta works hard to support her family and makes candles to earn a living. She started this business one year ago. She has applied for a loan to buy wicks, wax, cans and other materials for candle making. Norberta hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wicks, wax, cans and other materials for candle making.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 57 years old.  She is a widow and has one child.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has been in business for six years.  She also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Lucena is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to requesting this loan. 

Lucena aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.en:
Abelina is 38 years old.  She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school.  She operates a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in business for two years.

Abelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income earned from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-nine-year-old hardworking lady with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

She has been selling clothes for twenty years, she started with capital of five hundred shillings and now has over four million as working capital. She has challenges in price fluctuations. However she has a goal of expanding her business into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Luceta

texts.en:
Luceta is 65 years old, married, and has five children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luceta is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Luceta has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari sari (general) store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalina works hard to support her family. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen products. Rosalina is borrowing 19,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business. 

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 46, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, her business partner, and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Editha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Editha hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a fifty-year-old, hard-working man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been a farmer for the last twenty years. He was once a mechanic and after saving a reasonable amount he bought three acres of land and started farming.

His major hardships are high fuel and transportation costs, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather.  However, he has the goals of diversifying his farm, hiring employees to help expand his farm and buying land to grow crops.  The purpose of the loan is to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy meat, frozen foods and ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years. Teresita earns her income from her sari-sari store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, frozen foods and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is forty years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Susan has been in the pig fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She is forty years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Prima has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Prima requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more wood for her furniture making business.

Prima has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Prima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a thirty-five-year-old, married lady with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her children, build a permanent home and buy a car.  

She has been a farmer for fifteen years and also runs a retail shop.  She has started by using joint savings with her husband and bought four acre plot of land.  Her major hardships are price fluctuation and inflation, theft and seasonal weather.  Her business goals are diversifying her farm, hiring employees to help expand her farm and buying land to grow crops.  The purpose of the loan is to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.use: to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.name: Akuju

texts.en: Akuju, a 25-year-old married woman, has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Now requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase green vegetables and sweet potatoes, she will use the resulting extra income to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette, a 50-year-old married mother of one child who is in school, has been in the poultry business in the Philippines for 11 years now, and has received five loans in the past from NWTF. Now requesting a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her poultry, Bernadette would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

loans.name: Nazil

texts.en: Nazil is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car.  He has been a farmer for the last six years.  His major hardships are price fluctuations and seasonal weather.  He has a vision of expanding his farm and starting up a dairy.  Nazil needs this loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy two cows for rearing.

loans.name: Mindalina

texts.en:
Mindalina is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mindalina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from retailing gasoline.

Mindalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  maize for planting.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a married man from Sikatuna, Bohol. He sells firewood for a living. Restituto earns about 5000 PHP per month doing this business. He plans to use his loan to buy more wood to sell. 

Restituto works hard to improve his business and support his family. He hopes to have a progressive business and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bulk of used home appliances to resell.

loans.name: Borik

texts.ru:
Борик родился 1952 г., окончил среднюю школу в деревне  Арцваник, после окончание школы поступил и окончил Капанский строительный техникум.
Борик женат и у него трое детей: две дочери и сын. Обе дочери замужем и живут отдельно от родителей, а сын Борика сейчас служит в армии. 
Борик занимается сельским хозяйством более 10 лет в деревне Чапни, Сьюникского региона. Он выращивает овощи и фрукты, а также занимается пчеловодством. Выращенные овощи и фрукты Борик реализует в городах Капане и Каджаране, но особенной популярностью пользуется его мед, так как он всегда высокого качества. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством, Борик имеет возможность содержать свою семью. 
Сумма кредита в размере 1.000.000 драм необходима Борику для приобретения нескольких новых ульев, парафина для рамок, а также для покупки самих рамок для меда. 
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Бориком от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en:
Borik was born in 1952.  He graduated from high school in the Artsvanik village.  Upon completing his studies, Borik entered the Kapansky Civil Engineering College where he got his degree.  

Borik is married and has three children – two daughters and one son.  His daughters are married and live away from the parental home.  Borik's son is currently serving in the Army.  

Borik has been farming for over 10 years in the Chapni village of the Syunik area.  He grows fruit and vegetables and is also a beekeeper.  Borik sells the fruit and vegetables that he grows in Kapan and Kadzharan, but it is his honey that is particularly sought after because of its consistently high quality.  His farming business allows Borik to provide for his family.  

Borik needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 AMD to buy some new beehives, wax for the frames and frames for the honey.  This will be the third loan granted to him by Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some new beehives, wax and frames for his beekeeping business

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru: Махмадулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. На сегодняшний день Махмадулло занимается развозкой пассажиров на своем автомобиле марки "Хонда старекс". Он берет кредит для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу в зимнее время года.
texts.en: Mahmadullo lives in the Gissar District. He is 50 years old.  He is married and has 4 children. He has a high school education. Currently Mahmadullo is providing transportation services to passengers using his Hyndai Starex van. He is taking a loan to repair his vehicle, so he can provide safe service during winter months.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Malinga

texts.en:
Malinga is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for one year.

Malinga is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, cooking oil, and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cooking oil, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур и овощей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Мархабо имеет среднее образование. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Marhabo grows melons and vegetables. She has been engaged in this work for six years. She is 32 years old and married. She has four children. Marhabo has a secondary-level education. She is taking out a loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and tractor fuel.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tuamke Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Kevin is a 38-year-old married man with 7 children. Three of his children attend secondary education. He has been growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 12 years. He is facing farming problems, such as a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Kevin is asking for financial support to help him to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He has hopes of increasing his farming scale from 5 to 13 acres in the next 5 years. He would also like to own a good house and be capable of paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 38 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Meyli

texts.ru: Мейли 51 год, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Мейли работает библиотекарем в местной школе. В  поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Мейли начала свой бизнес в разведении скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости,  Мейли смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 3 коровы, 35 овец и две лошади, приносящее около 10,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мейли обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и жеребцов. В ближайшем будущем, Мейли планирует вложить доходы в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Meyli is 51 years old, married, and has brought up five children. Meyli works as a librarian at a local school. In search of an additional source of funds for her family, Meyli started her livestock breeding business, using an initial sum of 4,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work and persistence, Meyli was able to expand the farm, which now includes 3 cows, 35 sheep and 2 horses, and brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) from sales of dairy and meat products. 

In order to further expand her business, Meyli has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep and stallions. In the near future, Meyli plans to invest her profits in additional heads of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and fruit seeds to grow.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares who is a 42 year old man, married with three sons and two daughters, has a store for selling fruits and vegetables. He wants to purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to have a better collection in his store to resell and increase his income as it is the only source of income to the family. To ensure that his business is very successful, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Fares gets the loan, he will purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to his store, so he will have a better collection and have the ability to satisfy costumer needs, his sales will increase and so will his income. This will enable Fares to offer better living conditions to his family. Fares is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Stella is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Big Five Neighbours Group

texts.en:
This is  Betty, a 48-year-old married mother of four children from Zimbabwe. Two are still at school. She also cares for four  other dependents from her extended family; among the dependents two are also still going to school. 

Betty runs a  business selling used clothes that she buys from South Africa and Mozambique. The business has been in operation for six years. Betty says the main challenge faced is stiff competition at the marketplace since some other traders have a wide range of stock. 

Betty has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes in bulk for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance the well-being of both families. In the future Betty plans to have a clothing shop selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old, married, and supports seven people in his family. He has been in farming for the past four years. 

He is a humble client who learned about KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to spend it on preparing his land for farming and purchasing maize seeds. He anticipates getting profits which he plans to plough back into the farm.

He dreams of becoming a big farmer and he believes that he can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to spend on preparing his land for farming and purchasing maize seeds.

loans.name: Sharifmo

texts.ru: Шарифмо жительница района Рудаки. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Шарифмо занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном занимается торговлей детской одежды. В этой области она восемь лет. Кредит берет для покупки новогодних костюмчиков и курток.
texts.en: Sharifmo lives in the Rudaki Region. She is 47 years old.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is in Russia. Sharifmo sells goods at a market. Primarily she is selling children's clothing. She has been in this business for 8 years. She is taking out a loan to buy New Year's Eve  costumes and jackets.

loans.use: to buy New Year's Eve  costumes and jackets.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a 26-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Sunday is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nalangu

texts.en:
Nalangu, a married woman with five children who depend on her, has been farming for a period of seven years, growing maize and selling part of each harvest to earn income.

Having learned about KADET through other women in the area, Nalangu is currently applying for her third loan in order to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizers and to hire labor for the farm. In the long term she hopes to grow a variety of crops and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 32-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children. She works with her husband to fulfill the family's needs. He has been working in a local company since 1995. As for her, she has fifteen years of experience selling Tupperware; she also decided to start her own home business. She visits her customers at home upon request. Today, she’s in need of a loan of 1,500 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more Tupperware for her inventory. This will enable her to diversify her sales and gain new customers, which will surely increase her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own home products shop.

loans.use: to purchase Tupperware

loans.name: Cejerina

texts.en:
Cejerina is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Cejerina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 54-year-old married man with three sons and four daughters. He is an employee with a decent salary, but he also has a farm raising sheep. He benefits from selling sheep products to increase his income and offer better living conditions to his family. Because his farm is successful, Omar wants to expand by purchasing more sheep and fodder. He needs a loan from FATEN to help him with the amount of money he has. Having this loan will help Omar increase his sales from sheep products, increase his income, and provide better living conditions to his family. Omar is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Nasuju

texts.en:
Nasuju is a married woman who has two children who depend on her. She has been practicing cash crop farming for a period of six years.

She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan amount to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizers and to hire manpower to aid in the farm work. 

Nasuju hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Matumaini Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Donald is a 46-year-old father of eight children. Two of his children attend secondary education and two attend primary education. He is doing better in growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 6 years. He has farming problems based on a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Donald is seeking working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is performing well in agricultural activities so in the next 5 years he could be able to buy an insecticides pump machine, build a good house, and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 43-year-old, married woman.  She lives with her husband and three children. Two of the children are still attending school and the other is working. She started selling clothes from her home in 1995.  She’s now working with her husband to earn higher revenues and cover their children’s educational fees. Her husband has owned a coffee shop for the past 16 years. Today, she wants to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional quantities of clothes, such as coats, scarves and pants. She notes that this Kiva loan will improve her business and thus allow her to gain more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: purchase clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a 23-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Lona is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sendeu

texts.en:
Sendeu is a 29-year-old single man who practices maize farming. He has been a maize farmer for the past eight years. 

He learned about KADET through another registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his third loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs (maize seeds and fertilizers).

He hopes to make a profit and use the amount to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид 39 - летний мужчина проживающий в районе Шахритус. Он женат. Он является отцом четверых детей. Абдурашид занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Abdurashid is a 39 year-old man, living in the Shahrituz district.  He is married and is a father of four children.  Abdurashid is involved in agriculture.  He grows vegetables for sale.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  Abdurashid is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 29 years old, married and a father of two children. He has been a farmer for the last nine years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his area. This is his first loan with which he has planned to purchase farming supplies, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals, and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher level of education. He an industrious man who will struggle to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Santaine

texts.en:
Santaine is 37 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for the last ten years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his area. This is his second loan with which he has planned to purchase farm supplies, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher level of education. He an industrious man who will struggle to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Ida Parfaite

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures en 2000 pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ayant fait preuve d'une bonne capacité d'épargne et des successives remboursements sans défauts de paiements,les prêts ont transforme puissamment  sa vie, elle a élargie son activité, elle a  acheté sa marchandises en gros et avec ses bénéfices elle continue a renforcer son activite.
Tres pragmatique, elle tient a aller vers l'avant, son ambition est d'aller elle meme a l'étranger pour  s'approvisionner, Elle prend soin de ses enfants et s'occupe valablement de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This forty-two year old client, single with two children in her care, launched into shoe sales in 2000 to provide for the needs of her children. Having proven a good capacity for savings and successive repayments with no defaults, these loans have powerfully transformed her life. She has enlarged her business, she has purchased wholesale merchandise, and with her profits she continues to strengthen her business.
Very pragmatic, she is keen to look to the future, and her ambition is to go abroad herself to stock up. She takes care of her children and attends validly to their schooling.

loans.use: to buy children's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 38 years old, married and a father of four children. He is a farmer, and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to prepare his land for wheat farming, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production and to educate his children.

His hope is to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build rental houses. He is a hard working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat farming.

loans.name: Rakita

texts.en:
Rakita is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children.  He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. 

He learned about KADET through advertising done by KADET staff. He has currently applied for his third loan with KADET, with which he plans to buy maize seeds for planting and chemicals for spraying. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to reinvest in the farm. 

He is an honest man who works hard to achieve his goals, and he can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting and chemicals for spraying.

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias is 35 years old and a married woman with six children. Five of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Lilias is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 37 years old. She is married and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband supports the family by selling drinking-water filters.

Khanh runs a business selling beverages, which she began eight years ago. The income from this activity helps her to feed her children and maintain their living conditions. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business will be successful and enable her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of beverages to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Salau

texts.en:
Salau has been farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 32 years old, married, and supports six people.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Жумагул 45 лет, замужем. Жумагул работает учителем начальных классов в местной школе и известна как взыскательный и профессиональный педагог. Свою любовь к образованию Жумагуль смогла привить и собственным пятерым детям, трое из которых получили высшее образование, две младшие – школьницы. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Жумагул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 2 коровы и 4 овцы, также она возделывает земельный надел с пшеницей и кукурузой. Будучи энергичным человеком, Жумагул выращивает в собственном саду  черешню, абрикосы, яблоки и малину.
  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумагул обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, Жумагул хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Jumagul is 45 years old and married. She works as a primary school teacher in the local school and is known as a demanding and professional pedagogue. Jumagul was able to impart her love for education to her own five children, three of whom have received higher education, while the two youngest girls are still in school. While looking for a source of additional income for her family, 5 years ago Jumagul started her own business raising livestock and growing crops. Today, her farm contains 2 cows and 4 sheep, while she also works a plot of land with wheat and corn. An energetic person, Jumagul also grows cherries, apricots, apples and raspberries in her garden. 

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle. In the future, Jumagul would like to grow her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan, 44, is a married woman with three children, two sons and one daughter. Nhan and her husband make cane chairs to earn a living. They started this business four years ago, and they live in Ho Chi Minh City.  

Nhan is requesting a loan to purchase more cane and materials. This will enable her to work with her husband to increase their production of cane chairs. She hopes that this will help them make a higher income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more cane and materials to produce cane chairs.

loans.name: Perasuna

texts.en:
Perasuna has been practicing crop farming on his land for the last six years. He is 32-years-old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар проживает в районе Шахритус. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него четверо детей. Сафар более шести лет занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Кроме того Сафар в летнее время года занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safar lives in the Shahrituz district. He is married, is 37 years old, and has four children. Safar has been involved in agriculture for more than six years. He has a small plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. Safar also sells groceries in the summertime. He is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Lekitony

texts.en:
Lekitony is 40-years-old, married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 14 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his third loan with which he has plans to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to highest level of education possible. He is hard-working man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Deyaa'eddeen

texts.en: Deyaa'Eddeen, who is a 22-year-old man, has a profitable project which is a shop selling chickens, slaughtered and cleaned. And as a result of increased customer demand, Deyaa'Eddeen wants to purchase more broiler chickens for his shop, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to supplement the amount of money he has. When Deyaa'Eddeen gets the loan, he will be able to fulfill his customers' needs for broiler chickens that have been slaughtered and cleaned to be ready to cook. This loan will encourage Deyaa'Eddeen to expand his shop more in the future by having other sections in his shop. Deyaa'Eddeen is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase broiler chickens for sale.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Umoja Mikalanga Group

texts.en:
Donatus is a 32-year-old father of three children. Two of his children attend primary education. He is a good farmer dealing with the production of coffee, maize, and beans together with sugar cane for over 3 years. He has challenges with farming activities - basically a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Donatus spends most of his time finding money to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is also working hard to meet his target of increasing the scale of production from 5 to 13 acres, remedy his house, and own private transport in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en:
Yeu, 59, is widowed and looks after her seven children, four sons and three daughters, by selling beverages, which she has done for the past ten years. She and her children live in Ho Chi Minh City.

She would like to take a loan to expand her business by selling basic foods, such as noodles and snack foods. She hopes that this will increase her income and permit her to better feed and meet the basic needs of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by selling basic foods, such as noodles and snack food.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Thuong is 35-years-old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver for hire. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thuong earns a living by making clothes from her home. She intends to take a loan to open a general store in her house to sell basic household items and instant food for people in her community. This will enable her to make a greater income to better meet her customers' needs. Thuong hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to sell basic household items and instant food for people in her community.

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No is 35-years-old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works at the local airport. No earns a living running a general store, which she has done for four years.

No would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectioneries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectioneries, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ningbéri

texts.fr:
Ningbéri est une femme âgé(e) de 56 ans. Elle est mariée à un technicien et a 04 enfants. Un seul va à l’école. Le premier a 33ans et le dernier 21.
Ningbéri travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et des céréales depuis 2010. Elle vend à la maison à toute personne et achète les produits à Lomé.
Ningbéri a requis son crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de sa satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Ningbéri voudrait élargir le commerce Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer l’avenir de ses enfants surtout la benjamine.
texts.en:
Ningbéri is a 56-year-old woman. She is married to a technician and has four children. Only one goes to school. The firstborn is 33 and the youngest 21 years old.

Ningbéri has been selling charcoal and cereals since 2010. She sells from home to all types of individuals and buys her products in Lomé.

Ningbéri requested her loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise in order to satisfy her clientèle. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Ningbéri would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her children's future especially that of the youngest.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and cereals.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est un homme âgé de 24 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Komi travaille comme coiffeur et revendeur de télés de DVD et autres  depuis 2008. Il vend à la maison et achète à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché.
Komi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Komi voudrait agrandir par la vente d’autres produits afin d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Komi is a 24-year-old single man without children.

He works as a hairdresser and dealer of TVs, DVD players and other equipment since 2008. He sells from his home, buys in Lome and his main difficulty is competition in the marketplace.

Komi has requested his first WAGES credit loan to purchase more goods; he wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Komi would like to expand his business by selling other products in order to have a happy family.

loans.use: Buy TVs, DVD players, and other equipment

loans.name: Christelle Nadine

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 37 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants qui sont tous sur le banc de l'école.Elle se lance dans la vente des sous vêtements,des vêtements pour enfants et adultes en 2005, quand elle divorce avec son mari.
Elle a deja beneficiee de plusieurs prêts qui lui ont permis d'élargir son commerce ,elle achète des sous vêtements tel que slips hommes, dames et vêtements  en gros et pour enfants et adultes qu'elle vend a des bon prix en détail au marche.

Elle a fait énormes épargnes et avec ses benefices, elle continue a renforcer son activité, avec le temps, elle tient a ouvrir une grande boutique pour habits, elle fait les frais d'écolage de ses enfants et assure l'avenir et l'équilibre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christelle Nadine is a 37-year-old shopkeeper, unmarried with two children who all go to school. She began selling undergarments and clothing for children and adults in 2005, when she divorced her husband.

She has already benefitted from several loans that allowed her to expand her business. She buys undergarments such as men's and women's underpants, and clothing for children and adults wholesale, which she sells at a good retail price in the market.

She has accumulated enormous savings and with her profits, she continues to strengthen her business, pays for her children's schooling and ensures the future and balance of her family. With time, she wants to open a large clothing store.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Nigmat

texts.ru: Нигмат более семи лет занимается выращиванием овощей и зерновых культур. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его сын находится в России на заработках. Он берет кредит для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nigmat has been involved in growing vegetables and cereal crops for over seven years.  He is 55 years old, married and has five children.  His son is in Russia for work.  Nigmat is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 48-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Dung's husband sells fish and shrimp in a small market. She earns a living by running a general store, which she has done for seven years. 

Dung would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nha

texts.en:
Nha is a 36-year-old married woman. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living by washing and selling old vehicles.

Nha has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop and selling beverages to people in her community. She has been in business for six years.

She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and other materials.

loans.name: Saney

texts.ru: Саней 50 лет, вдова, воспитала шестерых детей. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Саней начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 5 голов коров, позволяющее зарабатывать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также она возделывает 3,5 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает фасоль.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саней обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, Саней хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Saney is 50 years old, a widow, who raised six children.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, she started her own animal husbandry and farming business five years ago, with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, her farm has five heads of cattle, allowing her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of milk and dairy products.  Saney also works on 3.5 hectares of arable land, where she grows beans.  In order to further develop her business, Saney requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  In the future, Saney wants to grow her farm and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a rice and drinking water merchant. She’s 41 and married with two daughters. Her husband is a painter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga sells rice and drinking water in front of her house, and she is open for business the whole day. She is currently asking for a loan to purchase many different varieties of rice and water products in bulk from wholesalers. This will enable her to offer her customers good quality rice and water products at more competitive prices and help her to attract additional customers.

Her goal is to increase her sales and income from her business in order to better meet her family's needs and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and water products in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Gladys is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Gladys has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Gladys to generate greater profits and educate her children. Gladys hopes that in the future she will be able to build a good, permanent house. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gladys's future prospects by helping her to educate her kids and to learn how to save.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is 40 years old, single, and for a time was staying at home babysitting her sibling’s child.  After a while, she started to get bored and began thinking about what she could do.  She enrolled in a wood painting and jewelry making course.  Asuman started making jewelery and selling to those around her. When she learned that the municipality was going to open an art bazaar for women, she made an application. She was given a stand and began selling her wood paintings, the jewelry she made, and lingerie that she bought in Istanbul at the bazaar.  Later, she heard from a woman in the stand next to her about Maya and applied for an individual loan.  

Asuman has been working in the bazaar for six years and with Maya for five years. This will be her first Kiva loan. She will use the capital to buy jewelery and wood supplies and to buy a wider variety of lingerie products to increase her sales.

In the future, she wants to increase her profits. With the additional profits, she is considering opening a store.  Asuman would like to get married one day. Asuman is considered by those around her to be determined and reliable.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and voluunters

Asuman 40 yaşında,bekar ve bir süre evde kardeşinin çocuğuna baktı.  Daha sonra sıkılmaya başladı ve ne yapabilirim diye düşünmeye başladı.  Ahşap boyama ve takı kursuna kayıt oldu.  Asuman takı yapıp,etrafına satmaya başladı.  Belediyenin kadınlar için stand açtığını öğrendi ve başvurdu.  Sanat sokağında Belediyenin standında, ahşap boyama,yaptığı takıları ve İstanbul’dan aldığı çamaşırları satmaya başladı.  Sonra,yan standtaki bir kadından Maya hakkında bilgi aldı ve bireysel kredi için başvurdu.  Asuman bu işi 6 yıldır yapıyor,Maya ile de 5 yıldır çalışıyor.  Bu onun ilk Kiva kredisi.

Bu bütçe ile, takı ve ahşap malzemesi,ve satışlarını arttırmak için, kadın iç çamaşırı çeşidi alacak.

Gelecekte, kazancını arttırmak ve kazandığı ile dükkan açmak istiyor.  Asuman bir gün evlenmeyi arzu ediyor.  Asuman, azimli ve güvenilir.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, wood supplies, and lingerie products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy  is 49-years-old, lives in the airport community, and she is married and her husband is a businessman. They have nine children between 13 to 22 years old. For the past sixteen years she has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  used clothes for her business. Her plan is to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells various kinds of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and support her family. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Scovia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and take good care of her family's hygiene and health.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sevinc Mercan

texts.en:
Sevinç is married and without children.  She has been making and selling cakes from her home for a long time. She started off by selling cakes to her close connections  and when her customers were very much pleased with her products she started selling cakes to people in other parts of her city.

Sevinç believes that her love of baking will enable her to improve her products and that her cakes will reach a wider and more diverse clientele in time. Because of the increasing demand for her cakes she has been in need of more practical and professional equipment, such as a really good mixer. With her first loan from Maya she will buy herself a mixer. 

She would love to open up her own bakery in the future, a place different from your ordinary pastry shop, where she can sell the cakes that she has prepared with a lot of artistry. Sevinç says that her husband is very supportive of her opening her own bakery. All-in-all she is a very creative and driven woman.

I  think this sentence should say: With her first loan from Maya she will buy herself a mixer.

Translated from by Turkish Maya Staff and voluunters


Sevinç Hanım, evli ve çocuğu yok.  Uzun zamandır kendi evinde pasta üretimi ve satışı yapıyor.  Öncelikle kendi çevresinde satışa başlamış ve müşteriler memnun kalınca farklı kesimlerde de satmaya başlamış.  Sevinç Hanım, bu işi severek yapınca,kendini daha iyi geliştirebildiğini düşünüyor,böylelikle daha fazla kesime ulaşmanın kolay olduğunu düşünüyor.  Siparişlerini arttırınca, daha kapsamlı malzemelere ihtiyaç duyduğundan, çok iyi bir miksere ihtiyacı olmuş.  Maya’dan aldığı ilk kredi ile kendisine mikser aldı.İleride kendine ait bir pastane açmak istiyor.  Fakat rutin pastanelerden biraz farklı düşünüyor çünkü pastalarını sanat eseri gibi hazırladığını söylüyor.  İleride pastane açmasını eşininde çok istediğini söylüyor.  Sevinç Hanım,çok yaratıcı ve azimli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy herself a mixer.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Шерали имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет зерновые культуры. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 17 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the Djilikul area. He is 33 years old, married and has four children. Sherali has a small plot of land where he sows crops. He has been engaged in this kind of activity for 17 years. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fertilizer for the planting of winter wheat.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 55 ans, veuve avec 5 enfants , ayant considérée sa charge a la mort de son mari, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie au marche pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
