Cette cliente a deja reçu plusieurs prêts , elle a fait des remboursements effectifs et a des épargnes considérables.
A l'octroi de son prêt , elle va acheter des ballots de friperie des robes et des marinières et bodies pour adultes. L'impact est considérable, elle fait de benefices qui lui permettent de prendre soin de sa famille et de s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants. 
Tres entreprenante, elle tient a aller loin, ouvrir un dépôt de friperie et pousser ses enfants a finir leurs  etudes universitaires .
texts.en:
Henriette is a 55-year-old shopkeeper, and a widow with five children. Taking into consideration her responsibilities upon her husband's death, she began selling used clothing at the market to meet her family's needs.

This client has already received several loans. She has effectively reimbursed her loans and has considerable savings.

When her loan is granted, she is going to buy bundles of used clothing, dresses and smocks and bodysuits for adults. The impact is considerable; she is making profits that allow her to take care of her family and to pay her children's school fees.

Very much an entrepreneur, she wants to go far, open a warehouse of used clothing and encourage her children to finish their university studies.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing, dresses, smocks and bodysuits.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla is 56 years old; she is married and has four adult children. She earns a living by breeding cattle and selling them for meat products as well as milk and other dairy products. Leyla has been involved in this business for 20 years. She started with one calf. She is working tirelessly toward her dreams of expanding her business, building a stable, and increasing her number of animals. She wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN to make repairs at home to improve housing conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize, beans and ground nuts to resell.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 24 years old and has two children, aged two and three. She owns a general store, and she is married to a mechanic. 

The loan will be used to buy more rice and sugar to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children. She would one day like to own a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Corethe

texts.en: Corethe is 55 years old and has five children aged 19 to 32. The youngest child is currently in school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 10 years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. Corethe will use any profits to provide for her family and create savings. Her dream is to one day own a guest house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 48 years old and is married to a farmer. She has five children aged 12 to 27. The two eldest are in school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy more beans and sorghum. Christine will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 35-year-old married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes, in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.
Cecilia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan, to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 27 years old and is single. He sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. Jean Bosco would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell in his shop. Any profits will be used to renovate his house and create savings for his future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Bedriye

texts.en:
Bedriye is married and she has two children. She has an art atelier. She has been busy with this work for four years. She has customers from all the segments of the society. At first she had opened a small workplace, but then after she transformed it into a very beatiful art atelier. Now, with her second credit, she wants to  buy a machine for glass processing. She wants to widen the variety of the products in her atelier. Also in this sense, the credit is very important for her. She aims to enlarge her atelier and educate students in this field. Bedriye is a successful, determined artist.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and voluunters

Bedriye Hanım evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Sanat atölyesi var,4 yıldır bu iş ile uğraşıyor.  Her kesimden müşterileri var.  Küçük bir dükkan olarak açılan yeri, ilerleyen dönemlerde çok güzel bir sanat atölyesine çevirmiş.  Maya’dan aldığı  bu 2.kredi ile,cam işleyebilmek için bir makine alıcak.  Atölyesinde,ürün çeşidini geliştirmek istiyor bu nedenle çektiği kredi kesinlikle onun için çok önemli.  İleride atölyesini daha büyütüp,bu alanda öğrenciler yetiştirmek istiyor.  Bedriye Hanım,çok başarılı,azimli ve sanatçı.

loans.use: to  buy a machine for glass processing.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 29-years-old and married to a driver. She has 3 children aged 3 to 7. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. Domina would like a loan to buy beans and sorghum to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and to create savings. She dreams to one day own a motorbike to help her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 25-years-old and has 2 children aged 5 and 6. The eldest child is in school. She owns a general store which she has run for 5 years.  Marie Chantal would like a loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, and flour to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to renovate her house and create savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt for selling.

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is married and has 3 children aged 2 to 7. The eldest are in school. She sells sorghum and beans in a shop she has run for 3 years. The loan will be used to increase the volume of sorghum and beans for sale. Clemantine will use any profits to build a house and pay school fees for her children. She dreams to one day own a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is 41-years-old and married. She has 8 children aged 12 to 25 years old. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. Viviane would like a loan to buy beans and sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to buy a domestic animal and a goat, and to create savings for her future. She dreams to one day to run a store to sell wood.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en: Petronille is 27 years old and has two children aged 2 and 3. She sells foodstuffs which she has been doing for 5 years. She would like a loan to buy beans, sorghum, tree tomatoes, and pineapple to sell in her store. Any profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She dreams to one day own a cow.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy kapenta and clothes.

loans.name: Bertird

texts.en: Bertird is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children aged 3 to 20 with 3 of them currently in school. She owns a small store where she sells juice, rice, and fruits, which she has been doing for 3 years. She would like a loan in order to buy more rice, salt, sugar, and juice to sell. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She dreams to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, sugar and juice to sell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 31 years old and has 3 children aged 6 months to 10 years.  She also adopted another child whom she cares for. She sells sorghum in a shop she has run for 5 years. Olive would like a loan to buy more sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She would like to one day own a cow to provide nutrition for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is 33 years old with 4 children aged 10 to 15. All of her children are currently enrolled in school. She sells clothes in a store she has run for 15 years.  Flavia would like a loan to buy more women’s clothes to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams to one day own a home.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leh We Help Weself Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Leh We Help Weself” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kamasikie village, in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Zainab (pictured right) is the leader of this group. Zainab is aged 35. She was born in Kamasikie village, where she currently resides with her husband. Zainab has been a businesswoman for the past 10 years. She sells market food: palm oil, rice, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the abovementioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 20-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for six months.
Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns extra income from pig-fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 12 children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Elisa  is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Sarah has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is 59-years-old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerenciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Emerenciana has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine, feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 61-years-old and married with 6 children. With 1 child in school, Adela works very hard to provide for them.

Adela runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Adela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Adela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Benjamina Gigi

texts.en:
Benjamina Gigi is 48-years-old and married with four children.

Benjamina Gigi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bread and other groceries to sell.

Benjamina Gigi has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Benjamina Gigi aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bread and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 64 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

Virgincita raises livestock in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.
Virgincita has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virgincita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 42 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

Carmelita buys and sells native products such as baskets in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional native products for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets and other native products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 37 year old married woman with four children, two of whom go to school.  She has had a  food stall in Yei, south Sudan, for five years.
Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan, to purchase onions and beans for sale at her food stall.  She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for her food stall.

loans.name: Normanita

texts.en:
Normanita is 52 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF, to buy more stocks of items to sell.

Normanita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 9 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Normanita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 48 years old, married and has 6 children.  Two of her children are in school.  Mildred lives in the Philippines and raises pigs for a living.   

She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Mildred has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old and married with 5 children.   Two of her children go to school.   Marilou works very hard to provide for her children.

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF, to purchase more inventory for her store.
Marilou has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other groceries at her store. 

In the future Marilou would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.
Margie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 38 years old and married.  Her husband is a farmer.  She has been selling sorghum and beans in a shop for 10 years.  

Esperance would like a loan to invest in her business and buy more sorghum and beans to sell in her shop. Profits will be used to renovate her house and create savings for her future.  In the future, she would like to have a warehouse full of sorghum.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Word” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kamasikie, a village in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is N'yama.  N'yama is age thirty-three; she was born in Kamasikie village where she is currently residing together with her husband and her child. N'yama sells cooked rice and has been a businesswoman for ten years now. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy cooking materials: rice, palm-oil, onions, vegetables, etc. in a large quantity, to produce a large quantity of cooked rice and sauce for sale. 

(The women next to the one at the extreme left was a member of the group but was later dropped shortly after the photo has been taken)

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, onions, vegetables, etc. in large quantity in order to produce a large quantity of cooked rice and sauce for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Margarita is 59 years old and has 3 children in school.

Margarita has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Margarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Margarita has been in this business for 40 years.  In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and married with 4 children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Luzviminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Зинат 44 года, вдова, имеет пятерых детей, младшая из которых школьница. В 2003 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Зинат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 коровы, 8 овец, 8 коз и  приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Доходы от такой деятельности позволили Зинат оплатить обучение своих детей и провести небольшой ремонт дома.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зинат обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. В будущем, Зинат хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Zinat is 44 years old, a widow with 5 children, the youngest of which is a schoolgirl. In 2003, while looking for income source for her family, Zinat started her own business in raising livestock with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS. Because of her perseverance and persistence, she currently owns 4 cows, 8 sheep, 8 goats and is earning around 7,000 KGS per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. The income from this business allowed Zinat to pay for her children's education and do small repairs in her house. In order to further develop her business, Zinat came to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 55,000 KGS to purchase sheep.  In the future Zinat wants to increase her property and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 30 year old a married woman with four children; three of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for three years.

Peres is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Leonora would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fuerza Corazón De Lampa Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Fuerza Corazón de Lampa” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados con el comercio, ellos trabajan en diferentes ferias libres. Y Todos ellos pertenecen a la comuna de Colina.
Irma presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usando una polera con rayas horizontales de colores rojo, blanco y Calipso. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo específicamente frutas y verduras en distintas ferias libres de su comuna, además ella comercializa artesanías del pueblo de Pomaire. 
Se inicia en el negocio desde joven ya que la mayoría de su familia es comerciante. Tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras que trabaja en conjunto a su marido y su puesto de artesanías en greda, las que adquiere a un artesano fabricante de Pomaire. Trabaja de martes a domingo en tres ferias distintas y pronto espera integrarse a una cuarta feria ubicada en el centro de la comuna.   Además durante esta temporada participa en la feria navideña de su comuna la que funciona en un horario vespertino.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, de tal forma de abastecerse de artesanías para la época de navidad, vendiendo principalmente pesebres con la Sagrada Familia.
Sus metas en su negocio, son consolidarse como comerciante y poder trabajar de manera independiente y más formalizada en un local establecido.
Irma vive junto a su marido,  su suegra y su pequeña hija Daniela de tan solo tres años de edad, quien la motiva para salir adelante.
Su mayor sueño dice relación con la adquisición de su vivienda, ya que esto le permitiría consolidar su familia, y además poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera de ver crecer y participar activamente de la educación de su hija.
Su mayor motivación en relación al negocio es consolidarse como microempresaria y poder sacar adelante su familia y poder dejar un Patrimonio a su hija.
De su experiencia en Fondo Esperanza destaca lo útil que le ha sido el financiamiento para esta época del año, le parece interesante el hecho que le ofrezcan la posibilidad de participar en las reuniones y capacitaciones impartidas en la institución, por lo que también recibe una ayuda integral. 
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Fuerza Corazón de Lampa" consists of 16 entrepreneurs, who are involved in different areas related to trade. They work in different open market fairs, and they all belong to the municipality of Colina.

Irma is president of the community bank. In the photo she is standing in the front row, second from left to right, and wearing a shirt with red, white and calypso (aquamarine) horizontal stripes. She is active in retail trading, specifically selling fruits and vegetables at various open markets in her community. She also sells crafts from the village of Pomaire.

She started in the business at an early age as most of her family are merchants. She has a fruit and vegetable stand she runs jointly with her husband and a stand for clay handicrafts, which she acquires from a craftsman in Pomaire.

She works from Tuesday to Sunday at three different market fairs and soon expects to join a fourth market located in the center of town. At this time of year she is also involved in the town's Christmas market which is scheduled in the evenings.

With a credit loan to buy merchandise for her business, she will stock up on crafts for the Christmas season, mainly to sell manger scenes showing the Holy Family. Her business goals are to become an established merchant, and be able to work independently with formal standing in a more permanent structure.

Irma lives with her husband, her mother-in-law and her young daughter Daniela, who is only three years old and is her prime motivator for success. She says her biggest dream is related to the purchase of her own home. This will enable her to strengthen her family and solidify her business, in a way that allows her to see her daughter grow and actively participate in her education.

Her main motivation with relation to her business is to become established as a micro-entrepreneur, improve her family's condition, and leave an inheritance to her daughter.

Her experience with Hope Fund highlights the usefulness of financing at this time of year. She found interesting the opportunity to participate in meetings and training within the institution, so as to receive comprehensive support.

Colina is a community in the metropolitan area north of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is currently the focus of major investments, especially in the agro-industrial sector. This is due to the installation of large and important companies, which provide a large number of jobs to the community.

It is also an area of welcoming subdivisions, which has helped to increase significantly the number of its inhabitants. It also has adequate space devoted to tourism, such as spas, water-sports on Laguna Piedra Roja and mountain-climbing.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business, and stock up on crafts for the Christmas season, mainly to sell manger scenes showing the Holy Family.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to customers for her rice retail business.

Johnna has been in this business for 5 years. Johnna earns more income from sari-sari store and food vending.

Johnna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alie's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of the Islamic Agricultural Vocational Institute located in Makeni. This institute was set up in 1986 by the Islaaha Mission to promote education in the region. The institute is staffed with eleven employees and has an enrollment of 364 pupils.

The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their small salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Thirty-nine-year-old Alie is the leader of this group of teachers.  He was born in Kambia district in northern Sierra Leone. Alie is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – two of whom are in secondary school and one is in college. Alie has served in the teaching profession for twenty years now. He has requested for this loan in order to invest in his business. He has been doing business for eleven years now. With this loan, he is going to buy quality mobile phones and men’s wears (jeans, t-shirts, etc.) to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy quality mobile phones and men’s wear (jeans, t-shirts, etc.) to add to his business.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is a conservative woman, so her husband Sa'ed is photographed instead. Ola is a 24-year-old woman. She is married with two daughters, and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary in addition to his work in agriculture. Ola has a small grocery store that helps her to share living expenses along with her husband. She wants to improve her store by purchasing more basic groceries to resell, such as rice, sugar, canned foods...etc. So, she wants to take a loan from FATEN to help her purchase these groceries. When Ola gets the loan, she will be able to have a different collection of groceries to resell and increase her income. This will enable Ola to share with her husband to offer better living conditions to the family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta works hard to support her family. Calixta is married and has a scrap (recycled materials) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Calixta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy damaged materials like plastic, metal, etc. to sell to a junk shop. In the future, Calixta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy damaged materials like plastic, metal, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies, stationery and other miscellaneous articles.  Beatriz has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies, stationery and other miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Emran

texts.en: Emran, who is 21 years old, is talented at playing the piano.  He is looking to buy a new instrument so he can improve his talent by training on it.  He needs a loan from FATEN to reach the payment amount.  When Emran gets the loan, he can buy a real piano and train more to improve his talent.  In the future, he is looking to make an income with his talent.  Emran is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: purchase a new piano.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 50 year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for one year.
Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 44 years old, lives in the Airport community, and is a widow.  She was educated up to 5th grade. For the past six years, she has been operating a table market where she sells peppers, rice by the cup, onions, salt, vita. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, vita for her business. Her plan is to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, rice, onions, salt, vita for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 50-year-old married woman with four children all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.
Angelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Self Help” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ya Marie. Ya Marie is age fifty; she was born in Magburaka town but she is currently residing in Makeni together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a carpenter and one of her children is in primary school and another is in college. Ya Marie has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now. She sells rice, vegetable oil, sardines, Peak milk (canned milk brand), etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice, cigarettes, vegetable oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, cigarettes, vegetable oil, etc. in large quantities to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Uulkelsin

texts.ru:
Уулкелсин  32 года, замужем, воспитывает  четверых детей – 8,6,3 года , и младшей дочери – 7 месяцев. Уулкелсин, преподаватель по специальности, проработала в детском саду четыре года. Сейчас, находясь в декретном отпуске, Уулкелсин занимается животноводством и полеводством, что позволяет покрыть часть расходов ее семьи.  
Благодаря упорному труду Уулкелсин, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает две дойные коровы, двадцать баранов. Также, Уулкелсин  возделывает 1,44 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкелсин обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы Уулкелсин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en: Uulkelsin is 32 years old, married and is raising four children, who are eight, six and three years old, and the youngest daughter is seven months old.  Uulkelsin is a teacher and spent four years working at a kindergarten.  Currently, being on a maternity leave, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, which allows her to cover some of her family's expenses.  Thanks to Uulkelsin's persistent work, today her business contains two dairy cows and twenty sheep.  Uulkelsin also works on 1.44 hectares of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and multi-year herbs.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a heifer.  Uulkelsin plans to invest the profits into increasing her livestock headcount further and dreams of buying a car for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 30-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for one year.
Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sebit

texts.en:
Sebit is a 50-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 21 and 8. All of them go to school. 

Sebit runs a food stall business and he has been in this business for 7 years. He has 1 employee. Sebit heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 3000 to purchase items like wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, milk, sugar and many others. In addition to this business, Sebit has another source of income from his shop rent. 

In 5 years time, Sebit would like to have a better future like having a good house. 

His major challenges include the low income rate and high cost of goods.

Sebit says that he appreciates the help from Finance Sudan .

loans.use: to purchase items like wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, milk, sugar and many others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer, soda and mineral water to resell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 35-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had her business selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, beans, and tomatoes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions, beans, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 24-year-old young woman who is married with no children yet. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. Aya has a beauty salon located in a good area close to the place where she lives. The income she earns from the salon helps her and her husband with their living expenses. 

Aya wants to make some improvements to the salon such as painting, installing lights, and making some decorations. She also wants to buy new beauty salon kits including hair creams, different types of hair brushes, hair dryers, etc. She would like to request a loan from FATEN to help her buy these things. 

When Aya gets the loan, she will be able to pay for the necessary improvements to her salon and will be able to purchase new beauty salon kits. This will enable her to improve her salon and share the living expenses with her husband which will improve their living conditions. Aya is a conservative woman, so her husband Abdullateef is photographed instead.

loans.use: To improve the beauty salon's condition and purchase new beauty salon kits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Beatrice Rama

texts.en: Beatrice Rama  is a hair dresser and also sells banku. Beatrice's husband is a security officer and has 3 children. She has been in this business for 7 years. Beatrice uses her income to support her hushand in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be use to purchase more hair kits and maize for the preparation of the banku. Beatrice will expand her salon with the profits.

loans.use: purchase more hair kits and maize for the preparation of the banku.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  hace ya bastante tiempo, vive en casa de su hermano, La cliente es soltera sin hijos, le va muy bien con su negocio ya que por el tiempo que vende ya sabe de donde proveerse de mercadería a un bajo precio, la Sra. María solicito el crédito para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor como arroz y fideo y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo  por las fiestas de fin de año ya que estas épocas  tendrá más demanda de sus productos, la Sra. María es una persona joven responsable con ganas de superación, esta es su única fuente de trabajo para mantenerse a ella y a su hermano, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María has been selling groceries for some time now.  She lives in her brother’s house, is single, and has no children.  Her business is going very well for her.  Because of the amount of time she has been selling she knows where to stock up on merchandise at a low price.

María requested the loan to buy groceries like rice and noodles wholesale.  This way she will increase her working capital for the end of the year festivities.  There will be a greater demand for her products during this season.  

María is a responsible young person who has the desire to improve herself.  This is her only source of work to support her brother and herself.  She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene el negocio de vender pasabocas preparados con masa de maíz, producto  muy natural, que vende en un sitio cercano a su casa, ubicada al suroccidente de la ciudad donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 8 años. A esta actividad se dedica desde el año 2007, desde que una amiga le prestó el primer capital para iniciarlo, con el compró los equipos y herramientas de trabajo e inició en la esquina de su barrio los fines de semanas. Al principio vendió deditos y empanadas, gradualmente su reconocimiento en el barrio fue creciendo y con ellos su sueño de tener mas clientes y los encontró trasladándose para un lugar muy cerca al hospital de un barrio contiguo,  donde existe una natural clientela que consume sus productos.  Su meta es lograr ubicar un punto de venta nuevo para generar mas ingresos simultáneos y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con lo que comprará materias primas e insumos,  para preparar los productos y comercializarlos en un corredor comercial muy reconocido y es potencial de venta inmediata. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y por eso se esmera en trabajar día a día, con el fin de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Nancy has a business selling snacks prepared with corn dough, a very natural product.  She sells at a place close to her house.  It is located to the southwest of the city where she lives with her husband and their three children, who range in age from six to eight.

She has devoted herself to this business activity since 2007 when a friend lent her the capital to start it.  She used the money to buy equipment and working tools, and she started selling on the corner of her neighborhood on the week-ends.  At first she sold “deditos” (finger cookies) and empanadas.  

She was gradually becoming well-known in the neighborhood, and the business was growing as well as her dream of having more customers.  She found them when she traveled to a place very close to the hospital in an adjacent neighborhood.  There are regular customers there who consume her products.

Her goal is to manage to get a new sales location in order to generate more income simultaneously.  That is the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use her loan to buy the ingredients and supplies to make the products.  She will sell them in a well-known commercial corridor, which has the potential for immediate sales.

Her dream is to have her own house.  That is why she works very carefully day to day in order to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to make food products and to sell them.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells plastic bowls and baskets at Besease. She is married to a farmer and has 2 children. Maame has been selling this since 6 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the raising of their children. Maame will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls and basket for sale.  Maame will expand her business with the profit.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls and baskets

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa  used to sell soap but now sells bags and footwear. She has been doing this for the past 6 years now. Yaa is married to a mason and has 2 children. She uses her income to support the husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be use to purchases more bags and footwear for sale.  With the new profit Yaa plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase more bags and footwear for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more cloth for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Elizabath

texts.en: Elizabath sells ladies' shoes, pomade, bags and ladies' jeans at Besease for the past 5 years now. She is married with 2 children. Elizabath uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more shoes, pomade and bags for sale. With the new profit Elizabath will acquire a shop for the sale of the goods.

loans.use: purchase more shoes, pomade and bags for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es: El cliente el señor Bladimir vive con su cónyuge la señora Adriana, tienen un hijo de dos años actualmente tienen una pequeña empresa donde se dedican a prestar servicio de guardia de seguridad para domicilios, fiestas y cualquier acontecimiento, actualmente están viviendo entre el cuarto y quinto anillo de la ciudad de santa Cruz, la casa donde viven es en anticrético, el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra de uniformes de seguridad  para los empleados  guardias ya que esta época de fin de año muchas empresas e instituciones están requiriendo el servicio de  guardias, razón por la cual tienen mucha demanda de personal y de uniformes, el Sr. Bladimir se siente  agradecido con la  institución por la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le dio.
texts.en:
Bladimir lives with his wife, Adriana.  They have a two year old child.  They currently have a small business where they offer the services of security guards for homes, parties, and other occasions. 

They are now living between the fourth and fifth rings of the city of Santa Cruz.  They live in a house under an “anticrético” arrangement.  (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.)

They will use the loan to buy security guard uniforms for the guards they employ.  During this end of the year season many businesses and institutions need the services of security guards.  That is why they have a great demand for personnel and uniforms.

Bladimir is grateful to the institution for how quickly they were taken care of and for the good service he received.

loans.use: to buy security guard uniforms.

loans.name: Nurys

texts.es: En la época mas linda para las familias colombianas, como la  navidad y el año nuevo, Nurys  siempre ha vendido a sus clientes accesorios domésticos navideños,  detalles para el hogar y fantasía femenina;  desde hace 15 años cuando inició su miscelánea, ella  adorna sus instalaciones, con la mercancía de cada época para llamar la atención de sus clientes,  que la conocen y con quienes sostiene una relación comercial, porque les vende a crédito y de contado diariamente.  Al iniciar su negocio lo hizo vendiendo artículos de modistería,  como hilos, botones correderas etc., cuando este fue creciendo,  agregó muchas otras mercancías,  que hoy aun vente, y con las que ha logrado estabilizar sus ventas hasta convertirla en una unidad productiva  con un gran potencial de crecimiento. Su espíritu emprendedor la ha guiado siempre, pues  logró  acceder a códigos de empresas,  a quienes les vende sus productos, mediante guía  especializada o catálogo y usualmente compra las mercancías que la revista trae en descuento,  para que sus clientes sientan las bondades de su oferta. Con su negocio ha logrado el bienestar de su hogar y ahorrar en su fondo de pensiones,  el que muy pronto la acreditara  como una jubilada más,  y pagaran su salario . Su sueño de crecimiento es imparable y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará mercancías variadas,  como ropa, artículos de aseo y  accesorios navideños. Con ello planea incrementar sus ventas y generar un poco mas de utilidades, pues aplicara su credikiva como un capital adicional que la llevará a esta meta.
texts.en:
Nurys has traditionally sold Christmas home accessories and miscellany during the Christmas and New Year holiday season so loved by Colombian families.  For fifteen years, she has decorated and created displays in the style of every era to attract her clients' attention.  Her customers know Nurys personally, and they are able to buy merchandise on credit or using cash.

She began by selling dressmaking supplies such as threads, buttons, etc.  As business grew, she added many other goods, which she still sells today, and through which she has managed to establish a profitable business with large growth potential.  Her entrepreneurial spirit has always guided her and afforded her access to businesses, to whom she sells her products through a specialized guide or catalog. She usually buys goods at a discount, passing on the benefit to her clients.


Through her business, she has achieved stability and wellbeing in her home.  She has managed to save toward her pension, which she will soon need as a new retiree.  Her dream is unlimited growth.  She comes to Kiva partner The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for financing in order to purchase various goods such as clothing, toiletries and Christmas accessories.  She plans to increase her sales and generate more income, applying loan funding as additional capital to reach her goal.

loans.use: buy various goods such as clothing, toiletries and Christmas accessories.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson presidente del grupo del Banco comunal “Gedeón II”, perteneciente a la comuna de La Pintana.
Se dedica a la prestación de servicios telefónicos, ya que repara y vende celulares, además de accesorios. Desde hace 6 años.
Comenzó con este rubro desde que su hijo le enseñó el oficio, por lo que está muy orgulloso y agradecido.
Nelson tiene un puesto en la feria, que cuenta con la pertinente patente de trabajo y su horario es de martes a domingo.
Comenta que cuenta con una extensa cartera de clientes que lo prefieren debido a la excelente entrega de servicios, además que Nelson garantiza su trabajo, por lo que sus clientes quedan conformes. 
Nelson además cuenta con un taller que habilitó en su propia casa, por lo que ahí se dedica a ordenar sus productos y repararlos. 
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, principalmente donde encuentre los precios más convenientes, por lo que se dedica a cotizar. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido en el centro de otra comuna, que le permita expandirse con su negocio.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, principalmente repuestos y accesorios de celulares. 
Comenta que hace poco tiempo, compró un vehículo que le permitirá  trasladar su mercadería, además comenta que su esposa también cuenta con un local en la feria. Por lo que le permitirá economizar con el traslado de ambos. 
Nelson vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19 y 4 años, además de un bebé de 8 meses de edad.
Sus sueños y motivaciones son seguir desempeñándose en su negocio, ya que esto le permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Nelson está muy agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además de las capacitaciones impartidas de manera integral en la institución, ya que ha aprendido a organizar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera. 
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que son muy unidos, solidarios y comparten además diferentes actividades e intereses, por lo que Nelson también se siente muy cómodo y considera al grupo como una segunda familia. 
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
Nelson is president of the communal bank "Gedeón II" which belongs to the Pintana community.  He has a phone services business where he repairs and sells cell phone, as well as accessories.  He has been in business for six years and started it because his son taught him the trade, so he is proud and grateful.

Nelson has a stall at the fairgrounds so he has the necessary work permit, opening Tuesday through Sunday.  He says he has an extensive list of customers who prefer his services because of the excellent delivery time.  Nelson guarantees his work so his customers are always happy.  He also has a workshop set up in his own home where he orders the products and works on repairs.  He buys his merchandise from different dealers, mainly from those who give him the best prices.  His business goal is to open a shop in the center of another community so he can increase business.

He plans to use the loan to buy supplies for his business, mainly cell phone repair parts and accessories.

Not too long ago he bought a vehicle to transport merchandise and since his wife also has a stall at the fairgrounds, this allows them to save on transport costs. 

Nelson lives with his wife and four children, ages 23, 19, 4 and 8-months.  His goal is to continue working so he can provide his family with a better quality of life.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being given by Fondo Esperanza, allowing him to invest in his business.  He also is grateful for the training received at the institution, since he has learned how to improve his accounting.

In the communal bank he belongs to he says the members are very united and supportive, and share different activities and interests.  Nelson is very comfortable with the group which he considers to be his second family.

La Pintana is a community located south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the Metropolitana region.  It is a poverty-stricken area where over 10% of the population is homeless.  The local authority (municipality) has developed several social programs focused on improving the local people's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business, mainly cell phone spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells slippers at Besease. She has been selling slippers for 2 years.  Eunice is married to an electrician and has one child. Eunice uses her income to help support the family. Eunice will use her loan to purchase more slippers. With the new profit Eunice will expand her busiiness.

loans.use: Eunice will use her loan to purchase more slippers

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a single mother and has four dependents, which she is responsible for raising.  Yaa sells tomatoes, garden egg plants, onions and other food items in Besease. She has been in business for the past 10 years.  Yaa will use her loan to purchase more tomatoes, garden egg plants and onions to sell.  With the additional profit earned as a result of this loan, Yaa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, garden eggplants and onions to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a petty trader and also sells kids wear in Besease.  Her husband is a mason and she has four children.  She has been in business for the past seven years.  She uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills.  Efua will use her loan to purchase more items to sell.  With the profit generated from this loan, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married to a carpenter and has two children.  For the past six years, Mercy has run a business, selling cosmetics in Beasease.  Mercy uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills.  She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell.  With the additional profit generated from this loan, Mercy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is married to a farmer and has four dependents.  Previously she sold cassavas and cooked rice but now she sells maize and rice porridge at Besease. She has been in business for seven years.  She will use this loan to purchase maize and rice in bulk for the preparation of porridge. With the additional profit generated from this loan, Christina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize and rice in bulk for the preparation of porridge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. Ekua sells hair creams, footwear, bags, and also prepares banku (a Ghanian cassava dish) for sale at Besease. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell.  Ekua plans to open a shop to sell her goods with the new profits she will get.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mildred Maria

texts.es: Mildred de 42 años es la propietaria de dos negocios en una sala de internet, donde también vende una gran variedad  artículos para damas caballeros e infantil y accesorios para el hogar; su negocio está  ubicada en un barrio del suroccidente de la ciudad, donde vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 19 y 22 años.  Ella inició esta actividad con un capital producto de sus ahorros como comerciante  en el año 2002; durante todo este periodo y  hasta llegar al año 2006 se dedicó al comercio, y en ese mismo año compró su primer computador  y una vitrina que surtió muy elegantemente y su negocio empezó a crecer y ella ha reinvertirle. Hoy cuenta con 5 computadores y 3 vitrinas ubicadas en un local muy ordenado y adecuado,  para el funcionamiento de su negocio, del cual se siente muy orgullosa. Su sueño de ampliación del negocio no tiene límites, porque en un futuro,  quiere convertirlo en un gran almacén de ropa y variedades;  su gran desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, para poder  responderle a su creciente clientela, especialmente en las épocas de gran movimiento comercial, como la que se acerca durante la navidad y el año nuevo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa para damas e infantil y productos cosméticos, porque quiere responder a los pedidos de  su clientela, lo cual potencializa el éxito de su inversión, pues se ajustará a la solicitud de sus mejores clientes y ella en el mercado tiene mucha experiencia y se las sabe todas.
texts.en:
Mildred, 42, has two businesses that she runs out of an Internet café.  She sells a wide range of women's, men's and children's articles and accessories for the home.  Her shop is located in a neighborhood southwest of the city, where she lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 22.  She began this activity in 2002 with savings.  Between 2002 and 2006 she worked as a merchant and in 2006 bought her first computer and an elegant display cabinet, and business began to grow through reinvestments.  She now has five computers and three cabinets in a very organized, well-appointed shop of which she is very proud.  Her dream is to expand her business because in the future she would like to turn it into a large clothing store with a lot of variety.

Her greatest challenge is having enough working capital and responding to customer demand, especially in times when there is a lot of activity such as Christmas and New Year's eve.  This is why she has requested a Credikiva loan, her first one through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to use it to buy women's and children's clothing and cosmetic products, so she can fill customer orders.  This will help make her investment successful since she will be attending to the wishes of her best customers.  She has much expertise in the market and knows how to conduct business well.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothing and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  is a kenkey (dumplings) seller at Besease near Elmina.  Adjoa has been in this business for 12 years.  Her husband is a farmer, and they have nine dependents.  She assists her husband in caring for their children. Adjoa will use her loan to puchase bulk maize for the preparation of kenkey.  With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, rice, and clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a businesswoman and sells cloth at Besease. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more items and cloth for sale. With the new profit, Elizabeth will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items and cloth

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es chofer  asalariado afiliado en una de las líneas de radio taxis que operan en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo  requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a la familia. José es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en  la zona  de Pasankeri  Sur de la Ciudad de La Paz. Una vez efectuado el análisis financiero el resultado indica que José es sujeto de crédito y puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
José is a salaried driver in one of the radio dispatched taxi services operating in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle because it’s his only source of income to support his family.  

Jose is married and has a son.   He lives in his parents’ house located in the Pasankeri zone in the southern part of the city of La Paz.  

The financial analysis done indicated that José qualifies for the loan and can access it.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for the preparation of kenkey (a dumpling)

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of one and ten. Two of them go to school. 

Monica runs a small food business, and she has been in the business for four years. She has two employees. Monica heard about Finance Sudan through the fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SSP to purchase more food items like cabbage, meat, flour, and many other things. In addition to this business, Monica has no other source of income.

In five years time, Monica would hope to change it to a restaurant. Her major challenges include paying school fees and home expenses. 
Monica says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping them get capital to start up a small-scale business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cabbage, meat, flour, and many other things

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es para la compra de ítem de- trabajo para el sindicato, pues es un requerimiento para poder trabajar y estar al amparo del sindicato. José Luís  es divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa de su hermana  ubicada en  la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito otorgado ya que- le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Es la primera vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
José Luis is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  The loan is to buy a work item for the syndicate because it’s a requirement to be able to work and be sanctioned by the syndicate.  

José Luis is divorced and has four children.  He lives in his sister’s house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa Nueva Potosí zone.  He is very satisfied with the granted loan because it will help him increase his income and thus help his family.  It’s the first time he’s worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a work item required by his taxi syndicate.

loans.name: Ermila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ermila;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son independientes y dos socios tienen 10, 3 años de edad; la socia tiene un restaurante en el cual expende diferentes potajes de la región, la socia es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, motivo que la lleva a destacarse en todo lo que emprende, ella en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor como son arroz en bolsas, aceite en bidones, papa, carnes, y otros productos que salen a diario en su restaurante, la socia mantiene el restaurante limpio y ordenado, también ella va viendo la entrada y salida de los platos, pese a que aún es un restaurante pequeño desea progresar y darle la calidad de un restaurante de categoría, la socia se levanta cada día con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo porque sabe que todo esfuerzo valdrá la pena y será destinado al bienestar de sus hijos y de sus familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para su restaurante como son arroz en bolsas, aceite en bidones,  fideos entre otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: This member belongs to communal bank "Señor del Calvario" ("Lord of the Calvary"), which is located in the district of Calca, province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The member is Ermila. She is 40 years old and single. She has four children, two of which are independent and the others are 10 and 3 years old. The member owns a restaurant where she serves various stews from that region. She is a very cheerful and hardworking woman, which is why she stands out in all of her endeavours. On this occasion she wants the loan in order to purchase wholesale goods such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, potatoes, meats and other foodstuffs that are used in her restaurant on a daily basis. The member keeps her restaurant clean and organized, and also oversees the orders. Although it is still a small restaurant, she wishes to make progress and provide it with the quality of a first rate restaurant. She wakes up every day with a lot of drive to keep on expanding, because she knows that all of her efforts will pay off and go towards the well-being of her children and her family. The member requests the loan in order to purchase goods for her restaurant such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, noodles, etc. She gives thanks for the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her restaurant such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo es profesor de ingles, realiza trabajos de traducción –y también dicta clases a domicilio. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora, la cual le ayudará mucho para organizar sus horarios y sus trabajos. Guillermo  es soltero  y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Central  de la Ciudad de La Paz. esta será la tercera vez que Guillermo solicita un crédito en Impro y la primera vez que su crédito será canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Guillermo in an English teacher; he does translations and also teaches private classes.  He needs the loan to buy a computer that will greatly help him organize his schedules and his jobs.  Guillermo is single and has two children.  He lives in his own house located in the central district of the city of La Paz.  This will be the third time Guillermo requests an Impro loan and the first time it will be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 32 años de edad,  vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con sus padres y hermanos; Allí mismo tiene su negocio de venta de pescados y aguacates, negocio que se dedica desde hace 2 años, aunque su experiencia emprendedora data desde hace 10 años, cuando muy joven, no terminó sus primaria y se dedicó de manera independiente a la venta de jugos naturales y productos fritos.  Con su negocio ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia que depende de él. Su necesidad de crecimiento está manifiesta y siente que cada día le alcanza menos el dinero para responder a su demanda creciente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará en mayor cantidad y de contado, bocachico, mojarra, bagre y aguacates, con esta inversión alcanzará a mejorar su capacidad de compra y atenderá a un mercado,  que ha dejado de atender por que siempre tiene el desafío de un capital de trabajo insuficiente.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 32 years old. He lives in the southwest area of his town with his parents and siblings. From there he runs his business selling fish and avocados. He has been in this business for the last two years, although his enterprising experience dates back 10 years. When he was very young, he interrupted his studies and began independently selling fruit juice and fried goods. With his business he has been able to support his family who depends on him. He has clear need for expansion and he feels that every day there is less money to meet his customers' growing demands. This is the reason why he turns to credikiva, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will purchase "bocachico" (a type of fish), bream, catfish and avocados in bulk and in cash. With this investment he will improve his buying capacity and cater to a market he has not catered to because he is constantly faced with the challenge of an insufficient working capital.

loans.use: to purchase "bocachico" (a type of fish), bream, catfish and avocados in bulk and in cash.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl se dedica a la venta de CDs y DVDs al por menor. El crédito que solicita es para aumento de capital para comprar mayor cantidad de Vds., pues en estas fechas navideñas suben sus ventas. Raúl es soltero y  tiene  dos hijos. Vive en casa alquilada  ubicada en la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los  créditos otorgados anteriormente (dos) que fueron pagado puntualmente. Esta es la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea enviado a kiva para fondeo.
texts.en: Raúl sells CDs and DVDs at retail.  The loan he’s requesting is to increase capital and sell a larger amount of DVDs because during the Christmas season sales increase.  Raúl is single and has two children.  He lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Villa Nueva Potosí zone.  He is very satisfied with his previous loans (two) which were promptly repaid.  This is the second time he’s wanted his loan to be sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs.

loans.name: Unidas Por El Amor Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal Unidas por el amor está integrado por once socias y un socio, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en su comunidad. 

Maria Salome, es la coordinadora del Banco Comunal, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, y reside en la comunidad del Rusio en el municipio de Juticalpa, Olancho. Es una mujer luchadora y tiene una pequeña pulpería que inició con el primer credito que obtuvo en FAMA en el 2002 y funciona en una pequeña parte de su casa de habitacion. 

El préstamo que está solicitando Maria lo necesita para comprar abarroteria en general como ser azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos y asi ella podra cubrir los gastos de la casa y su salud. 

Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a tener un minimercadito, tambien sueña con hacerle mejoras a su casa porque esta bien deteriorada Maria Salome ha sido cliente de FAMA por nueve años y espera pagar las cuotas de este nuevo prestamo de forma puntual y responsable como hasta en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Communal bank "Unidas por el amor" ("United for love") is comprised of eleven female partners and one male partner, all of which have various economic activities in their community.
Maria Salome is the coordinator of the communal bank. She is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a hardworking woman who lives in the village of Rusio, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. She runs a small grocery store in a small part of her home. She started the store with the first credit she received from FAMA in 2002.
Maria needs this loan in order to purchase general merchandise such as sugar, rice, refreshments, butter, meat, chicken, cold cuts, bread and other goods. With the support of this loan she will have a larger and more varied business, and her customers will be able to find everything they need to make their food. This way she can cover her home and health expenses.
Her goal is to expand her business and eventually own a general store. She also dreams of improving her home, because it is in pretty bad condition. Maria Salome has been a client of FAMA for nine years and she hopes to repay this new loan in a punctual and responsible fashion as she has done so far.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Olga tiene 20 años de realizar su actividad comercial.Combinando la atención de su casa en las primeras horas de la mañana,luego después del medio día hasta las 7 pm atiende el negocio.

 En un inicio fue una de las tiendas pioneras en su comunidad,pero actualmente ella enfrenta una competencia fuerte que ha logrado superar produciendo uniformes para los niños de educación prescolar de una institución privada,mejor atención,facilidades de crédito.

 También en algunos momentos ha enfrentado falta de capital, esto lo logra superar con el apoyo económico que le brinda fundación mujer.

 Este crédito le permitirá atender demanda de época navideña y financiar la compra de materia prima para la producción de uniformes para el curso lectivo que inicia en febrero.
texts.en:
Olga has had her retail business for 20 years. She divides herself between taking care of her home in the first hours of the morning and running the business from noon to 7p.m.
At first it was one of the pioneering stores in her community, but now she faces strong competition. She has been able to beat competition by making uniforms for preschoolers from a private institution and by offering better service and credit facilities.
She also has occasionally faced lack of capital and has overcome it with the financial support provided by Fundación Mujer.
This loan will allow her to meet the demands of the holiday season and to purchase supplies to make uniforms for the schoolyear which begins in February.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, home products and personal use products in order to stock up for the holiday season.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Porfirio nuevamente necesita un credikiva, pues es su fondo de efectivo con el cual aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello su productividad, sobre todo en esta època de buen movimiento comercial,  donde se levantan las ventas de estos productos. Con su credito anterior le fue muy bien y hasta logrò reinvertir sus utilidades, su negocio cada vez crece un poco mas y él se siente muy orgullosos de su trabajo. Su mensaje a los fianciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero", él ha logrado, aumentar su capital de trabajo, su liquidèz y sus ventas crecen constantemente; en la actualidad, debido a su gran mejoramiento y con la ayuda de sus familiares planea comprar su vivienda y esto lo hace muy felìz.
texts.en: Porfirio needs again a Kiva loan, because it is the source of cash which he uses to build up his working capital and with it his productivity, especially in this period when his products have a high turnover. He did very well with his previous loan and even managed to reinvest his profit. His business continues to expand step by step and he is very proud of his work. Porfirio has this message for the Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for the financial support." He managed to increase his working capital; his liquidity and his sales are growing steadily. Thanks to his improved well-being and the help from his family, he currently plans to buy his home and this makes him very happy.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Aida  Esther

texts.es: Aida logró con su anterior credikiva comprar mucho de sus productos,  que vendió muy bien y le generaron mayores utilidades por su compra de contado y en mayor cantidad, su fondo de crédito,  le ocasionó la disminución de sus costos, debido a  los descuentos que le ofrecieron sus proveedores. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para acceder nuevamente a un   credikiva con el cual comprará dulces, agua, refrescos, pues  su negocio está ubicado,  a la entrada del estadio de futbol de la ciudad y los torneos deportivos, no se hacen esperar, lo cual hará que su inversión sea exitosa.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Muchas gracias que me sigan apoyando porque gracias a Kiva he mejorado los ingresos y mi nivel de vida. “
texts.en:
With her prior Kiva loan, Aida succeeded in buying more products which sold well. She generated greater profits by purchasing them in cash and in greater quantity. Her loan allowed her to reduce her costs due to discounts offered by her suppliers.
