Now, she has applied to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a new Kiva loan with which she will purchase sweets, drinks, and soft drinks since her business is located at the entrance to a football stadium in the city. Sporting tournaments are approaching which will make the investment successful. She has the following message for Kiva lenders: “Thank you very much for continuing to support me. Thanks to Kiva my income and standard of living have improved.”

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks and soft drinks wholesale and for cash

loans.name: Shara

texts.es: Shara es abogada y presta servicios independientemente. El crédito que requiere  es para capital ya que emprendió el negocio de ventas de lentes de contacto y necesita comprar variedad de colores pues tiene clientes asegurados que le han hecho pedidos por anticipado. Shara es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Callampaya  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Shara es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y su historial de pagos es excelente. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Shara is an attorney and provides independent services.  The loan she requires is for capital because she started a business selling contact lenses and she needs to buy a variety of colors because she has assured customers who have placed prior orders with her.  Shara is single and has no children.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Callampaya zone.  Shara has been an Impro client since 2010 and her payment history is excellent.  This is the second time her loan will be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy contact lenses in assorted colors.

loans.name: Guisella Liliana

texts.es:
Guisela es madre soltera, con un hijo de 6 años de edad el cual esta cursando el nivel inicial, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, (arroz con pollo, tallarines, etc) eligio este tipo de negocio porque le parece rentable y económico, porque de esta manera puede generar mas ingresos para su hogar.  Guisela es una mujer honrada, trabajadora y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su hijo, empezó en el negocio hace 1 año y gana semanalmente un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles.
Guisela  vive y trabaja en Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half hours south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.
Con el crédito que se le otorgará gracias a kiva S/. 1500.00 soles será invertido para darle remodelación del local (ponerle piso de cemento), uno de sus desafíos es la competencia que tiene que superar todos los dias ya que ella no es la única que vende comida en el mismo lugar, y uno de sus sueños es terminar de construir su casa para que de esta manera le pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Guisela is a single mother with a 6 year old son who is enrolled in primary school. She is engaged in the sale of meals (rice with chicken, noodles, etc.). She selected this type of business because it appears profitable and cost effective and, as a result, can generate more income for her household.

Guisela is an honorable, hardworking, and responsible woman with a big desire for her son to get ahead. She began her business one year ago and earns an average of 200 soles per week.

Guisela lives and works in Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes but has persevered as it has for much of its history.

With the 1500 soles loan she has been granted thanks to Kiva, she will invest in the remodeling of her shop (putting in a cement floor). One of the challenges she faces is the competition which she has to overcome every day since she isn’t the only one who sells meals in the area. One of her dreams is to finish building her house and, in this way, give a better quality of life to her son.

loans.use: to remodel her shop by putting in a cement floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cases of beer and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene su vehiculo el cual lo utiliza para brindar servicios de taxi. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo, pues lo necesita en buenas condiciones para seguir trabajando y generar ingresos para mantener a su familia. Hugo es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa en anticrético la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Bajo Seguencoma de la Ciudad de La Paz. Su historial de pagos el crédito anterior es muy bueno y hace que Hugo califique para este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hugo has a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi service.  He needs the loan to do a complete maintenance service on his vehicle because he needs it to be in good working order to continue working and generating income to support his family.  

Hugo is married and has two children.  He lives in a house in the anticrético modality [a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] that’s located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Seguencoma zone.  His payment history on his previous loan is very good which makes him qualified for this new loan.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Freddy Ramiro

texts.es:
Freddy es una persona de 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pero es soltero, vive con sus hijos en Bolívar provincia del Carchi. Freddy se considera una persona trabajadora y honesta.

Freddy tiene un negocio de cerrajería en el patio de su casa, este negocio le ayuda a mantener a sus hijos ya que es el único ingreso que el tiene, su negocio se ve perjudicado ya que actualmente hay mal clima y no le permite trabajar ya que su negocio no tiene un techo, es por eso que realiza su séptimo crédito a Fodemi que va a invertir en la construcción del techo para su negocio.

Su sueño es poder tener un taller grande para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Freddy, 38, has two children but he’s single.  He lives with his children in Bolívar, El Carchi Province.  Freddy considers himself to be a hardworking, honest person.

Freddy has a metal shop in his yard that helps him support his children since it’s his only source of income.  The business is being damaged because the weather now is bad and he can’t work because he has no roof over his shop and this is why he’s taking out his 7th loan with Fodemi that he will use to build a roof over his ship.  His dream is to have a large shop so that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to install a roof.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and fourteen. All of them go to school. 

Muhamad runs a utensil store business, and he has been in the business for 12 years. He has one employee. Muhamad heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer's word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase items like glasses, cups, spoons, and many other things. In addition to this business, Muhamad has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Muhamad would hope to build a house.

His major challenges include the low income rate and high standard of living in Juba.

Muhamad says that he is appreciative of Finance Sudan for considering men too for the loans, because some of the microfinance institutions consider women only.

loans.use: to purchase items like glasses, cups, spoons, and many other things.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina;  La socia tiene 55 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 son independientes y 2 tienen 20, 18 años de edad; la socia tiene su propia molinera, la socia tiene en casa una molinera y ella también tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de trigo, maíz, entre otros productos; La socia aparte de moler sus productos y  venderlos en el mercado central, ella también alquila su molinera a sus clientes que luego llevan  a moler sus diferentes productos ya sea para la venta o para consumo propio, la socia es muy trabajadora y está cada vez mas satisfecha con los logros que viene obteniendo, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas como trigo, maíz, quinua y otros productos para sembrar.



La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 55, belongs to the “Señor del Calvario” communal bank which is located in Calca District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has five children three of which are independent and two who are 20 and 18 years old.  She has her own mill at home and she also has fields where she grows wheat and corn among other products.  Aside from milling her products and selling them in the central market she also leases out her mill to her customers who bring their various products to be milled either to sell or for their own consumption.  She is very hardworking and every time she’s more satisfied with the accomplishments she’s attaining.  

On this occasion she wants to invest the money to buy seeds like wheat, corn, quinoa and other products to plant.  She appreciates the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julia Mabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Julia Mabel;  La socia tiene 41años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 22, 13 años de edad; la socia tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diversos productos de abarrotes, la socia en esta ocasión desea implementar su tienda e invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como son arroz, azúcar, leche, harinas, fideos, mazamorras, huevos entre otros que salen a diario, y en la compra my especial en esta navidad de panetones, vinos, champan, para las fiestas navideñas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda e implementar los productos navideños para la temporada.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO". The community bank is located in the district of Calca in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Julia Mabel; she is 41 years old and single. She has two children who are 22 and 13 years old. She has her own grocery store and she sells diverse products. The member wishes to equip her store at this time and invest in buying the most needed products such as rice, sugar, milk, flour, beans, bread crumbs, and eggs, among others that sell daily, and also a special purchase for this Christmas season: seasonal pastries, wines, and champagne for Christmas parties. The member requests the loan to invest in her store and offer Christmas products for the season.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making payments as outlined in the schedule.

loans.use: to invest in her store and include Christmas products for the season.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz, de 32 años de edad vive al suroccidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 12 años. Ella tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, que compra a su cuñada y que provienen de Ciudad de Panamá. Así mismo, vende mediante guías especializadas, accesorios femeninos, para el hogar, ropa y variedad de artículos que vienen en las revistas, y que preferiblemente traen importantes descuentos, que su clientela siempre aprovecha, porque Diana Luz se encarga de dárselos a conocer muy oportunamente. Su idea emprendedora data desde el año 2007, cuando acudió a un crédito, con el compró pocas mercancías y gradualmente reinvirtiendo el capital prestado, logró cada vez mas obtener utilidades, que le permitieron pagar el crédito y lograr mas crecimiento. Su deseo es ampliar su microempresa y para ello requiere un fondo de crédito, con el cual comprar mas mercancía para venderla; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa femenina, e infantil sobre pedidos de sus clientes, pues estos esperan pasar la navidad y la nochebuena en familia, vestidos muy elegante con la ropa que Diana Luz le proporciona a crédito y que ellos le pagan poco a poco. Su mayor desafío es lograr adquirir su propia vivienda y sueña con lograr adquirirla y con brindarle en el futuro, una educación superior de calidad a sus hijos. Historial de reembolso
texts.en:
Diana Luz, 32 years old, lives southwest of the city with her husband and their 2 children, aged 7 and 12. She operates a business selling varied merchandise which she buys from her brother-in-law and comes from Panama City.  Diana Luz also sells, using specialized guides, feminine accessories and things for the home, plus clothing and varied articles from periodicals, that preferably, come with important discounts, which her customers always take advantage of, because Diana Luz always lets them know opportunely. 

Diana Luz's idea for her enterprise dates from the year 2007, when she took out a loan and bought a little merchandise and gradually reinvested the capital loaned. She increased her profits each time, which allowed her to pay off the loan and gain more growth.

Diana Luz's desire is to expand her micro-enterprise, and to do so requires a source of loans, with which to buy more merchandise to sell. This is the reason she is approaching 'credikiva' with her 1st loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will purchase feminine and children's clothing requested by her customers who want to spend Christmas Eve and Christmas among  family dressed very elegantly in clothing Diana Luz provides on credit, and they pay for little by little. 

Her biggest challenge is to acquire her own house and she dreams of that, and in the future, of providing a quality higher education for her children.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing to fulfill orders from her customers.

loans.name: Helga  Arlette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, célibataire avec un enfant, à l’arrêt de ses études en classe de terminal, elle monte un étalage de produits cosmétiques  qu’elle achète en  cartons et qu’elle vend en détail dans le marché.
Ses ventes sont de 40.000frs a 120.000frs et il ne cesse   d’épargner.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle veut renforcer le stock de nouveaux produits de lait de toilette, de crème de beauté,  des savonnettes, des huiles éclaircissantes, des défrisants et des crème démêlantes, des tissages et des pagnes.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une parfumerie et vendre  des produits divers et avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin de son enfant et de sa mere.
texts.en:
This customer, who is 42 years old, single and has one child, left school in the final year of "lycée". She has a display of cosmetics which she buys in boxes and sells on a retail basis at the market. Her turnover ranges from 40,000 francs to 120,000 francs and she is consistently saving money. With this new loan she is going to replenish her stock with new body milks, beauty creams, small soaps, hair lightening oils, defrizzing products, hair conditioning creams, hair weaves and "pagnes" (pieces of brightly coloured fabric).

Her ambition is to open a perfume shop and sell a variety of products; with the profits she makes she looks after her child and her mother.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, "pagnes", hair extensions and hair weaves

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 48 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married and has six children between the ages of six and twenty-one. They are in school and live at home. For the past twelve years she has been operating a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase cassava, fish, pepper, rice, onions, salt, and oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, fish, pepper, rice, onions, salt, and oil for her business

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción De Pilcopata” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pilcopata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. 

Rufino tiene 51 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, él nació en la ciudad Paucartambo pero actualmente, Rufino vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Rufino se dedica a la agricultura  y también se dedica  a la venta de carne de chanchos, pescado, pollo en uno de los mercados más prestigiosos de la ciudad de Pilcopata. 

En esta oportunidad Rufino requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho, pescado y pollo. Rufino se encuentra agradecido  a la Asociación Arariwa por que fue la primera entidad financiera que le préstamo capital para su negocio. 

Rufino agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rufino belongs to the Inmaculada Concepción De Pilcopata communal bank.  The members of the communal bank meet once a month in the city of Picopata, Paucartambo province, Cusco department.

Rufino is 51 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children.  He was born in the city of Paucartambo, but Rufino currently lives in the city of Pilcopata where he carries out his business activities.  He is a farmer, and he also sells pork, fish, and chicken in one of the most prestigious markets in the city of Pilopata.

At this time Rufino needs the loan to buy pork, fish, and chicken.  Rufino is grateful to the Asociación Arariwa because it was the first financial entity that lent him capital for his business.

Rufino appreciates and values the loan, and he pledges to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, and chicken.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora Elvira tiene un taller de costura donde elabora vestidos y arreglos en general. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como  telas , hilos, forros, cierres, botones, etc. Elvira es soltera y tiene tres hijos .Vive en casa como  cuidadora ubicada en la zona  de Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz. Elvira se encuentra muy feliz por los créditos otorgados anteriormente –fueron cinco, todos pagados en su totalidad - ya que le ayudaron a tener más ingresos y mantener su familia. Esta es la tercera vez que desea que su solicitud sea enviada a kiva.
texts.en:
Elvira has a dressmaking workshop where she makes dresses and general clothing repairs. The loan she needs is to purchase basic materials such as cloth, thread, linings, zippers and buttons, etc.

Elvira is single and has three children. She lives in a house located in the Miraflores zone of La Paz as a caretaker. Elvira is very happy with the loans made to her previously. She has had five loans and has paid all of them in full. They helped her to obtain a greater income and take care of her family. This is the third time that she has asked for her loan to be sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, linings and zippers to continue with her business making clothes and general clothing repairs.

loans.name: Laura Delia

texts.es: La Sra. Laura es una persona  trabajadora  que  día  con día se  esfuerza  por  sacar  adelante  a su  familia,  ella  se  dedica  a la venta de ropa usada lo  cual le a  permitido  salir  adelante   día  con día,  es  por ello  que  en  esta  ocasión  requiere   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  la  venta,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer   su  negocio lo cual le  generara  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Laura is a hardworking person who day by day makes the effort to get her family ahead.  She works selling used clothing, which has allowed her to get ahead every day.  Because of this she now needs to buy merchandise to sell.  She sees the loan as the possibility to make her business grow, which will generate greater income for her.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marizza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marizza;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17, 11 años de edad; la socia se dedica  la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja a la ciudad de Lima  cada 3 meses o según ella vea por conveniente, según la venta de sus productos, la socia vende sus mercadería en Calca y reparte a sus amistades y clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor y menor.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member, Marizza, belongs to Señor del Calvario Communal Bank, located in the district of Calca in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 42 years old and single with three children, ages 18, 17, and 11.

Marizza works buying and selling clothing.  She travels to the city of Lima every three months or when it is convenient for her, according to the sale of her products.  She sells her merchandise in Calca and distributes to her friends and customers.

She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothing wholesale and retail.

Marizza is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments in accordance with the payment plan.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Sadic

texts.en:
Sadic is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and fourteen. All of them go to school. 

Sadic runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 12 years. He has one employee. Sadic heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers’ word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1,000 to purchase items like milk, tea bags, sandals, and many other things. In addition to this business, Sadic has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Sadic hopes to build a house.

His major challenges include the low income rate and high standard of living in Juba.

Sadic says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s support.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, tea bags, sandals, and many other things.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Miguel es un hombre casado de 25 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad , uno tiene 2 años y el otro tiene 5 años el cual esta cursando el nivel inicial, el  se dedica al negocio del servicio de cabinas de Internet.  Miguel es un hombre luchador, trabajador con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a  su familia, lleva en el negocio hace 1 año, gana un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles semanales.  Con el crédito que se le otorgará gracias a Kiva de S/. 1000.00 soles, será invertido para  darle mantenimiento a sus máquinas (computadoras)
uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano les pueda dar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia y tener más espacio para sus hijos, su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si pagará puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Miguel lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Peru.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows jobless entrepreneurs to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Miguel is a married man 25 years old.  He has two minor children, one 2 years old and the other one 5 and in his first year of elementary school.  He has an internet cafe business.  Miguel is a fighter, a hardworking man who wants to get his family ahead.  He has had the business for one year and earns an average of 200 PEN weekly.

With the loan of 1000 PEN that he will be granted thanks to Kiva, he will invest in giving maintenance to his machines (computers).

One of his dreams is to have his own house so he can give his family a better quality of life in the near future and have more space for his children.  His advisor believes that he is a good client and will make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to give maintenance to his computers.
